Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do



Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units



Job Requirements



Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 5 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Strong data visualization skills



Bonus points for:



Good knowledge of Python
Git knowledge
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas



What We Offer



Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.



Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.


Show more
HTML:
Join Proton and build a better internet where privacy is the default

At Proton, we believe that privacy is a fundamental human right and the cornerstone of democracy. Since our inception in 2014, founded by a team of scientists from CERN, we have dedicated ourselves to providing free and open-source technology to millions worldwide, ensuring access to privacy, security, and freedom online.

Our journey began with Proton Mail, the largest secure email service globally, and has since expanded to include Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, Proton Drive, and Proton Pass. These tools empower individuals and organizations to take control of their personal data, break away from Big Tech‚Äôs invasive practices, and defeat censorship. Our work impacts hundreds of millions of lives, from activists on the front lines defending freedom to leaders in governments protecting sensitive information. In some cases, Proton‚Äôs services have even been instrumental in saving lives by enabling secure and private communications in high-risk situations.

Proton is a profitable company that does not rely upon VC funding, supporting over 100 million user accounts with a growing team of over 500 people from over 50 different countries, from the world's top companies and universities. We value intelligence, learning potential, and ambition in our hiring process. Adaptability is key as we navigate uncharted territories and redefine how business is conducted online.

Hiring at Proton is highly selective, with less than 1% of candidates hired. We believe smaller teams of exceptional talent will always prevail over larger teams with lower talent density. You will have the opportunity work with many of the world's top minds in their fields, ranging from former international math and science olympiad winners to chess champions.

We have a global mindset and big ambitions but remain a start-up at heart. We value empowerment and flexibility and keep our structure flat to keep moving fast and avoid unnecessary politics. Tired of blending into the crowd? Join us and do work you can truly be proud of. Check our open-source projects here!

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do


  • Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
  • Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
  • Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
  • Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
  • Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
  • Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units


Job Requirements


  • Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
  • Strong analytical skills
  • Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
  • at least 5 years of relevant working experience in the field
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL
  • Strong data visualization skills


Bonus points for:


  • Good knowledge of Python
  • Git knowledge
  • Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas


What We Offer


  • Office First: Collaboration is easier and more effective in person, which is why we have offices in Geneva, Zurich, Prague, Barcelona, Paris, London, Vilnius, Skopje, and Taipei. You can also enjoy working from home up to 30% of the time, while enjoying great company during our three core days in the office.
  • Technology: We provide all the devices and software you need to excel in your role, ensuring you have the best tools at your disposal to achieve your goals.
  • Food: Lunch and snacks are provided by Proton every day at our offices.
  • Transport: We will always support our employees with transport costs through subsidizing public transport, bike allowances, or parking spaces based on your office location.
  • Stock Options: At Proton, we are all owners of the company and you get stock options when you join us.
  • Flexible Working: You can define your own working hours as long as it works with team meetings.
  • Learning and Development: We are committed to your professional growth. Proton offers various learning opportunities, including training programs, conferences and events, and continual learning.
  • Employee Benefits: Comprehensive health insurance plans, competitive retirement savings options, generous vacation and leave policies, and wellness programs.
  • Work that Matters: Proton is a community-first organization, started with the support of a crowdfunding campaign and built with community input. To this day, Proton‚Äôs only source of revenue is user subscriptions. Over 100 million people trust and support Proton, and we put our users and community first in everything we do. Read more about our impact here.


Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Proton, we believe diversity drives innovation and strengthens our mission to provide privacy as a default for all. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all individuals, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, physical ability, or socio-economic background, feel valued and empowered. We strive to create equal opportunities, promote open dialogue, and support continuous learning to ensure every voice is heard and respected.

If you need any extra support or reasonable adjustments during the hiring process, please let your talent partner know.

Candidate Privacy Notice

When you apply for a position, refer a candidate, or are considered for a role at Proton Technologies AG (Proton, we, us, or our), your information is stored in Greenhouse, in accordance with their Service Privacy Policy. This information is used to evaluate your suitability for the posted position. We also retain this information for consideration for future roles that you may apply for or that we believe may align with your background and skills.

If we no longer have a legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it. Should you have any inquiries about how we use or manage your information, or if you wish to access, correct, or delete your data, please contact our privacy team at careers@proton.ch.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from candidates. We will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from an unsolicited offer, even if the candidate is subsequently hired by Proton.

To learn more about our privacy policy, please visit our privacy policy page.

Description:
Occident, una de las empresas con mayor relevancia en el sector asegurador espa√±ol, est√° emprendiendo, desde su departamento de Anal√≠tica de Negocio, la transformaci√≥n de la organizaci√≥n hacia un modelo data-centric.

Title: Internship in Data Analysis and Dashboard Development
Description:
Role Description As an Intern in the EMEA OPS team within the Service Supply Chain (SSC), you will play a key role in enhancing operational visibility by designing and developing data-driven tools and dashboards, primarily using Power BI. Your focus will be on analyzing data and creating user-friendly dashboards that provide live operational insights, helping the team extract meaningful conclusions to improve our parts shipment and repair operations across EMEA.
Requirements
Currently pursuing a degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field, with plans to graduate within the next year.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques, including Power BI.
Knowledge of database systems and experience with data visualization.
Effective communication skills for presenting insights and working collaboratively.
Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.
Nice to Have
Experience with programming languages such as Python or SQL.
Familiarity with supply chain operations or logistics processes.
Knowledge of other data visualization tools or advanced features of Power BI.
Previous internship or project experience involving dashboard development.
Interest in gaining practical experience in a dynamic, operations-focused environment.


Experience Our Benefits

Being part of HP means access to an international community with lots of growth opportunities within the company, professional development resources, networking opportunities, while enjoying in a great atmosphere making an impact.


You will be able to choose to either work office-based or hybrid work style.
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 6 to12 months agreement.
Lunch in the cafeteria.
Love sports? Then take advantage of our sports center (indoor and outdoor); gym, squash courts, tennis courts, basketball courts and with 25+ regular coordinated activities / sports , such as HIIT training, squash,‚ÄØbasketball and yoga.
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis, such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health.
Free printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs to large posters. And Hands-on‚ÄØworkshops‚ÄØto print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models.


Sounds like you? Please apply and let‚Äôs talk!

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile game studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games consistently rank among the top on iOS and Android, enjoyed by millions of players worldwide. As proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, our mission is simple: to create amazing gaming experiences and bring fun to everyone!

We‚Äôre looking for a Game Data Analyst to join our Analytics team. In this role, you'll analyze player behavior, collaborate with game teams, and help improve our games by driving retention and user conversion.

Using quantitative analysis, data science, statistics, and programming, you‚Äôll generate insights that make a real impact at Socialpoint. To succeed, you‚Äôll need to learn quickly, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and work closely with both analytics and game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?


Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions, turning our vast amount of data into actionable insights and transferable learnings.
Visualize and communicate the results of your analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Design and analyze A/B tests and other causal impact analysis to assess the impact of new features and changes.
Continuously educate stakeholders on data literacy and analytics best practices, to ensure they are empowered and autonomous to run analytically correct analysis.
Occasionally participate in advanced analytics projects, teaming up with other game data scientists & analysts to develop data tools and products.


Requirements


2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis.
Experience with A/B testing.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics. Prior experience with bayesian statistics is a plus.
Experienced creating dashboards and visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
A fast learner, highly meticulous and proactive individual.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.


What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?


Hybrid working model from home and office. What does this mean? You need to live within commuting distance of our Barcelona office to attend important meetings and events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona, if you're not already here.
An impressive 25 days of annual leave, not including public holidays.
An additional 5 days of annual leave during Christmas.
Full Catering for Breakfast and lunch at the office
Private medical insurance for you and your family to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest iOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons in English and Spanish.
Spotify Premium to add a special soundtrack to your adventure.
Legendary social events and parties to let off some steam.
Personal development is key for us: enjoy a significant budget to enhance your skills and knowledge, providing real growth opportunities!


What We Offer You:

Coming to work in the office? Don‚Äôt worry ‚Äì we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:


Gym Facilities: Want to stay in shape? We have state-of-the-art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
New Office: Enjoy our brand-new office, complete with top-tier amenities, including a professional barista and delicious breakfast options.
Onsite Physiotherapist: Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for any aches and pains.
Onsite Hairdressers: Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).


The list just goes on & on... so get your game on and apply now! Click ‚Äúapply‚Äù to level up and submit your application in English.

Diversity & Conclusion Statement

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, which means we are committed to creating and celebrating diverse thoughts, cultures, and backgrounds throughout our organization. Employment with us is based on substantive ability, objective qualifications, and work ethic ‚Äì not an individual‚Äôs race, creed, color, religion, sex or gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin or ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, status as a victim of domestic violence or sex offenses, reproductive health decision, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

As an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to providing the necessary support and accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities, health conditions, or impairments (subject to any local qualifying requirements) to ensure their full participation in the job application or interview process. Please contact us at recruitment@socialpoint.es to request any accommodations or for support related to your application for an open position.

Please be aware that Socialpoint does not conduct job interviews or make job offers over third-party messaging apps such as Telegram, WhatsApp, or others. Socialpoint also does not engage in any financial exchanges during the recruitment or onboarding process, and will never ask a candidate for their personal or financial information over an app or other unofficial chat channel. Any attempt to do so may be the result of a scamp or phishing attack, and you should not engage. Socialpoint‚Äôs in-house recruitment team will only contact individuals through their official Company email addresses (i.e., via a zynga.com, naturalmotion.com, smallgiantgames.com, themavens.com, gram.gs email domain).

Title: Data Analyst Senior
Description:
As a Data Analyst Senior, you are in charge of building SQL, Qlik and PowerBI data models to support key business decisions. You will collaborate with our product owners, guide your team members and work closely with our clients on their challenges requiring Data Foundations, Data Analytics, and Data Science.

As a Data Analyst Senior, you work closely with data engineers, bi analysts and product owners to create fast, efficient, and scalable data intelligence solutions for Werfen employees.




Key Accountabilities

Among others, you will:

‚Ä¢ Between 2 to 3 years of experience in a similar role, managing a team or multiple projects. Preferably in the digital/tech and health/diagnostics/life science space.

‚Ä¢Work with the team and business stakeholders to identify requirements, define models, and kickstart new analytics initiatives.

‚Ä¢Build data models with SQL and automate them with Python. Have deep knowledge of all the datasets inside the data lake to be able to provide guidance to stakeholders.

‚Ä¢Apply the correct data models to the business problem at hand.

‚Ä¢Leverage creative solutions, analytics, and visualization/ reporting techniques to enhance knowledge and drive actionable insights that deliver ROI.







Networking/Key relationships

Critical to be able to build relationships based in trust within the organization as the function is to respond to the internal customer needs while taking into consideration the overall corporate strategy.




Minimum Knowledge & Experience required for the position:

We expect that you have experience with:

‚Ä¢ SQL advanced

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of any programming language like Python

‚Ä¢ Power BI, Qlik or other dashboarding software

‚Ä¢ Statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular libraries and tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.




We will consider it an advantage if you also have familiarity with any of the following:

‚Ä¢ AWS

‚Ä¢ Microsoft Azure cloud computing

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with DataOps principles

‚Ä¢ Familiar with Agile methodologies

‚Ä¢ Git software versioning




Skills & Capabilities: We expect you to demonstrate proficiency in data analysis and have a keen interest in understanding various business domains. We will also need you to be able to communicate data concepts to non-technical colleagues.

‚Ä¢ You are fluent in English both orally and in writing.

‚Ä¢ You have good presentation skills.

‚Ä¢ You can communicate well within the team and with stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ You can analyze business requirements in dialogue with internal stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ You can collaborate directly with external consultants and vendors.

‚Ä¢ You are a team player willing to share knowledge, ideas, and banter.




Travel requirements: 5% of time

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Apply now ¬ª

We provide inspiration worldwide with our intelligent solutions for industrial automation. We offer a high degree of flexibility to our more than 20.000 employees. We provide you excellent prospects for turning your ideas into reality ‚Äì because innovation requires freedom and security. We need you. Apply now and keep the world moving.

Senior Data Analyst

About FESTO: FESTO is a leading global company in automation technology and technical education. We are committed to driving innovation and providing high-quality products and services to our customers. Our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona is at the forefront of driving data-driven decisions to optimize our sales processes and strategies.

Job Summary: We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Data Analyst to join our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in data analysis, a strong analytical mindset, and the ability to turn data into actionable insights.

Key Responsibilities


Lead the collection, cleaning, and analysis of large and complex data sets to support business operations (sales, web analytics, marketing‚Ä¶).
Develop and maintain advanced reports, dashboards, and visualizations to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and drive business insights.
Develop and present comprehensive data-driven insights and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders.
Mentor and guide junior data analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
Review and oversee tasks performed by junior analysts, ensuring accuracy and quality of work.
Conceptualize, follow up, and deliver analytics projects, including definition of KPIs, creation and communication of insights, and project definitions for junior analysts.


Qualifications


Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field. A PhD is a plus.
5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a sales or business analytics role.
Strong analytical skills, attention to detail and technical leadership
Advanced knowledge of SQL and experience with large-scale cloud data analysis frameworks
Proficiency in Python and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Ability to extract and translate business metrics and questions from data sets into well-documented and actionable insights.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex data-driven insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Fluent in English; proficiency in Spanish is a plus.


What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
A collaborative and innovative work environment.

Your information will be used exclusively by Festo Automation and handled in accordance with applicable data protection laws.

We provide inspiration worldwide with our intelligent solutions for industrial automation. We offer a high degree of flexibility to our more than 20.000 employees. We provide you excellent prospects for turning your ideas into reality ‚Äì because innovation requires freedom and security. We need you. Apply now and keep the world moving.

Senior Data Analyst

About FESTO: FESTO is a leading global company in automation technology and technical education. We are committed to driving innovation and providing high-quality products and services to our customers. Our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona is at the forefront of driving data-driven decisions to optimize our sales processes and strategies.

Job Summary: We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Senior Data Analyst to join our Digital Sales Hub in Barcelona. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in data analysis, a strong analytical mindset, and the ability to turn data into actionable insights.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead the collection, cleaning, and analysis of large and complex data sets to support business operations (sales, web analytics, marketing‚Ä¶).
  • Develop and maintain advanced reports, dashboards, and visualizations to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and drive business insights.
  • Develop and present comprehensive data-driven insights and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders.
  • Mentor and guide junior data analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.
  • Review and oversee tasks performed by junior analysts, ensuring accuracy and quality of work.
  • Conceptualize, follow up, and deliver analytics projects, including definition of KPIs, creation and communication of insights, and project definitions for junior analysts.

Qualifications

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field. A PhD is a plus.
  • 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a sales or business analytics role.
  • Strong analytical skills, attention to detail and technical leadership
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL and experience with large-scale cloud data analysis frameworks
  • Proficiency in Python and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
  • Ability to extract and translate business metrics and questions from data sets into well-documented and actionable insights.
  • Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex data-driven insights clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Fluent in English; proficiency in Spanish is a plus.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development.
  • A collaborative and innovative work environment.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Competitive Intelligence
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a Senior Analyst in our AXSI team, you'll lead competitive intelligence initiatives and drive strategic decision-making. You'll spearhead the development and execution of sophisticated analytical frameworks that shape & strengthen our market position.


Lead Competitive Analysis: Dive deep into market trends, analysing strategies employed by industry players to acquire budgets and launch campaigns with our clients.
Client Consultations: Conduct in-depth discussions with clients to understand their testing processes and decision-making factors when evaluating different advertising solutions.
Performance Testing: Design and implement sophisticated testing strategies to showcase Criteo's superior performance and value proposition.
Strategy Development: Contribute to our pool of competitive strategies and help shape the roadmap for our competitive intelligence tools.
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to transform complex business challenges into groundbreaking solutions.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial teams and clients to deliver insights that drive revenue and foster client success.



Who You Are:


4+ years of experience in data analytics, with expertise in competitive intelligence and market analysis
Demonstrated experience leading and delivering strategic projects that directly impact business outcomes
Advanced proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools, with a track record of building scalable analytical solutions
Strong leadership skills with experience mentoring junior analysts and managing complex stakeholder relationships
Strategic mindset with proven ability to translate complex market insights into actionable business strategies
Experience presenting to and influencing senior stakeholders
Track record of developing and implementing innovative analytical methodologies
Advanced problem-solving skills with experience tackling ambiguous business challenges
Fluent in English with exceptional communication skills and ability to influence at all levels
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions



Diverse experiences enrich our team. Even if you don't tick every box, we want to hear from you!

We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Our mission? Making day-to-day banking easier for SMEs and freelancers thanks to an online business account that's combined with invoicing, bookkeeping and spend management tools. Thanks to its innovative product, highly reactive 24/7 customer support and clear pricing, Qonto has become the leader in its market.

Our journey: Founded by Alexandre and Steve in July 2017, Qonto has rapidly gained trust, serving over 500,000 customers. Thanks to our wonderful team of 1,600+ Qontoers, we also made it to the LinkedIn Top Companies French ranking!

Our values:

Customer focus | Prioritize customers in everything you do

Ownership | Own your part, get things done

Teamwork | Make (team)work easy

Mastery | Continuously raise the bar

Integrity | Always do what‚Äôs right, and respect people

Our beliefs: At Qonto, we're committed to fostering a welcoming environment where everyone can thrive. We prioritize evaluating applicants based solely on skills and potential, ensuring diversity with 50% international team members, 44% women, and 20% parents. Join us in building a workplace that celebrates diversity and individuality.

Discover the steps we took to create a discrimination-free hiring process .

Growth Data Analyst

Shape the Future of European Business Banking

Transform raw data into growth strategies that impact businesses across Europe

Our Mission:

At Qonto, we're revolutionizing business banking for SMEs and freelancers across Europe. Data isn't just numbers to us - it's the cornerstone of our decision-making and the fuel for our rapid growth. As our Marketing Data Analyst, you'll be at the intersection of data and business strategy, directly influencing how we expand our footprint in the European market.

üë©‚Äçüíªüßë‚ÄçüíªYour Impact:

Join our team of data analysts where you'll:


Drive Qonto's expansion strategy through data-driven insights
Uncover growth opportunities that could impact thousands of businesses
Partner with stakeholders across Spain, France, Serbia, and Germany to shape our European success story.
Be part of a dynamic BI organization that's central to Qonto's strategic decisions


üéØ Your Key Missions:


Strategic Performance Monitoring: Design and implement sophisticated monitoring systems that track our growth trajectory and spot opportunities
Growth Detective: Lead investigations into performance patterns, transforming data anomalies into actionable acquisition strategies
Analytics Democratization: Create intuitive self-service analytics tools that empower our growth team to make data-driven decisions
Strategic Partnership: Be the trusted data advisor to our growth department, challenging assumptions and driving data-informed strategies
Quality Champion: Help set new standards for analytics excellence, ensuring our insights are both powerful and reliable


üë• The Team Experience:


Work alongside a diverse, international team of five growth experts spread across Europe
Learn from various experience levels, including staff members and senior analysts
Enjoy a culture that values autonomy, quick learning, and strong relationships
Tackle exciting challenges that require creative problem-solving and innovative thinking


ü§ù Your Future Manager: Omar

Meet Omar, our Lead Data Analyst who:


Built Qonto's analytics team from 4 to 25 talented individuals
Brings rich experience from airline revenue management and ad tech industries
Is passionate about mentoring and developing data talent
Will help you grow both technically and strategically in your role


üèÖ What Makes You Stand Out:


Analytical Prowess: You have a proven track record in growth analytics, particularly in areas like onboarding or website analytics
Business Acumen: You don't just crunch numbers - you understand the business implications behind them
Technical Excellence: You're proficient in Python, SQL, and Tableau, with an eagerness to expand your technical toolkit
Communication: You can translate complex data insights into clear, actionable recommendations
Innovation Mindset: You're excited about finding creative solutions to complex data challenges
Statistical Thinking: You can distinguish meaningful patterns from statistical noise


‚ôüÔ∏è Why This Role Matters:


Direct impact on Qonto's European expansion strategy
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge analytics tools and methodologies
Chance to shape the future of business banking
Work in a fast-growing scale-up that values data-driven decision-making


Diversity & Inclusion:

At Qonto, diversity isn't a checkbox - it's our strength. We believe the best teams are built on different perspectives, experiences, and backgrounds. We encourage applications from everyone who feels they can contribute to our mission, regardless of traditional qualifications.

üèÜ What We Offer:


Work with a purpose: Help transform business banking across Europe
Growth opportunities: Learn from experienced data leaders and tackle complex challenges
International exposure: Collaborate with teams across multiple European markets
Innovation culture: Be part of a team that's pushing the boundaries of fintech


At Qonto we understand that true diversity isn't just about ticking boxes on a hiring checklist. Apply regardless of the boxes you tick! Who knows? You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we've been searching for all along.

üéÅ Perks

A tailor-made and dynamic career track. An inclusive work environment. And so much more to help you succeed.


Offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, Barcelona, and Belgrade;
Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for and where you live;
Competitive salary package;
A meal voucher;
Public transportation reimbursement (part or global);
A great health insurance (depending on the country);
Employee well-being initiatives: access to Moka Care to take care of your mental health and great offers for sports and wellness activities;
A progressive disability and parenthood policy (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners;
Monthly team events.


üí¨ Our hiring process:


Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers
A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like


We will send you an interview guide so you can best prepare yourself.

On average, our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours ü§û

To learn more about us:

Qonto's Blog | Les √âchos I L'Usine Digitale | Courrier Cadres

To know how your personal data will be processed during your application process or to request its deletion, please click here .

Title: VF Analytics Specialist
Description:
Description

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. Operations is at the heart of what we do, delivering hundreds of thousands of items each day and fulfilling customer orders from all over the world.

As an VenforFlex Analytics Specialist, you will have the opportunity to support operations to improve and monitoring Customer Experience metrics for Vendor Flex sites across EU. We seek a strong candidate that can prioritize well, communicate clearly, and has a consistent track record of delivery. You must have the experience and capability to partner with other teams to ensure providing insightful call-outs, support and suggested actions to the Operations teams and their stakeholders. You will be responsible of providing added value reports on Transportation, Inventory Quality, Concessions and other Customer Experience (CX) KPIs at an EU level. You will monitor and action CX issues impacting the network.

A key to influencing shareholders is to have the ability to solve complex, technical problems with simple, innovative and practical solutions.

Key job responsibilities


Business analysis and partnership across Amazon with Supply Chain, Transportation and Ops leaders to develop new standard operating opportunities.
Leverage ideas from Support Teams to source and nurture creative improvement plans for the Flow Analytics.
Take proactive steps to ensure that best practices are being shared, standardized across all the sites.
Be a Subject Matter Expert on Operations, Transportation, and Customer Experience.
Continuously monitor performance of sites that are attributable to Flow Analytics and take corrective steps whenever required to optimize productivity performance and Customer Experience.


A day in the life

This position is office-based 5 days per week.

Basic Qualifications


Relevant experience in a logistics/operations environment.
Intermediate proficiency in verbal and written English (B2 in the Common European Framework of Reference, CEFR)
Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical skills that allow using data from SQL/workbench/QuickSight to provide thought-provoking and workable solutions. Data is what you look to when given a problem to solve.
Strong knowledge of Lean / Six Sigma or alternative continuous improvement methods, and their application in industrial settings.
Previous experience working at Vendor Flex and having a deep knowledge of its systems and processes.
You typically volunteer to lead projects and help your team achieve goals. You have a track record of taking ownership and driving results.
You see value in long term thinking and large scale impact to a company. You have interest in developing a long-term career through assignments in multiple operational buildings across the nation. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Company - Amazon Spain Fulfillment, S.L.U.

Job ID: A2916473

Title: Internship - Data Analyst for Sales Operations (6 months starting March 2025)
Description:
Hybrid -
Barcelona, Spain
Commercial
Internship

Job ID: r18495

What You'll Do

Before applying, please make sure your school will be able to provide a 6-month internship agreement - it is a mandatory element to start a full-time internship at Criteo.

Criteo is looking for a Sales Operations Data Analyst to join our Emerging EMEA Sales Strategy Team. The ideal candidate will be highly data-driven, and process-oriented, as well as an exceptional team player.

The intern will report directly to the Senior Sales Strategy Business Partner to provide support in all Sales Strategy functions across channels and countries with main focus on evaluating sales and account management performance, improving efficiency through automation and best practices sharing and leading discussions on process improvements and strategy.

Please note that this is a 6-month internship (full-time) based in Barcelona, Spain.

Key Responsibilities


Support EMEA in all processes linked to the regular business cadence (e.g. quarterly business planning, monthly pipeline reviews) and help ensuring data accuracy in all processes.
Support weekly and monthly business performance review, challenge the teams and track progress on associated priorities
Support accurate data input and adoption of Sales Solutions and associated Sales Effectiveness Processes within the region.
Ensure data integrity of Salesforce and other Sales Solutions.
Support new business territory sizing and support new business strategy & action plan


Who You Are


Fluent proficiency in English
Advanced Excel skills
Ideally, a strong proficiency or keen interest in technical skills such as SQL, programming languages, etc.
Interest and proficiency in analysis and statistics
Demonstrated track record of cross-functional facilitation and collaboration in a matrix organization
Ability to foster positive relationships to achieve organizational goals in a multicultural environment
Expertise in developing and implementing streamlined processes
Capacity to work autonomously, with meticulous attention to detail, and a high sense of prioritization


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: Associate Product Data Analyst - Experiments & Insights
Description:
Associate Product Data Analyst - Experiments & Insights - (Hybrid)

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking a junior Product Data Analyst to join our Experiments & Insights team in Barcelona (hybrid) to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment. If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

21 million customers ‚Äì 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 6.5M members in Prime

Over 1,600 employees ‚Äì More than 60 different nationalities from all continents

99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world‚Äôs leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionizing the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. Our Experiments and Insights team is the centre of excellence for Online (AB) Experimentation and for providing best practices to generate insights and learning from and for the experiments. As an Associate Product Data Analyst inside the team, you will be in charge of:


Analyse performance and identify behaviours in our different websites and interfaces related to our products;
Analyse performance and user behaviours in the A/B Tests experiments or Pre-Post run by the product teams;
Help the product teams to generate their testing hypotheses by providing exploratory analysis about our products, past tests, etc,
Data cleaning and validation,
Definition of new tracking that will all mostly be added in Google Analytics (to be able to answer different kinds of research/product questions);
Build and maintain dashboards (mostly using LookerStudio) and/or reports (mostly in Google Sheets) to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders;
Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge;
Responsible for one or more team‚Äôs projects such as the investigation and implementation of new methodologies, new data analysis techniques or the usage of new tools;
Collaborate with user researchers and designers to detect gaps in knowledge about our user; identify research opportunities to fill those gaps.



NOTE: Data you will be using could come from Google Analytics API or Google Analytics tables in BigQuery, other sources of data stored in BigQuery such as internal databases, customer service database, etc., as well as our data stored and accessible in Microstrategy.

What you need to succeed:

Good to have

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline is a requirement (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.),
Minimum of 2 years experience in a role with strong analytical component,
Previous experience in user behavior analysis (product performance) using data from any of the following: Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics/Mix Panel/ Amplitude/Matomo/‚Ä¶
Strong knowledge of the math and statistical concepts behind A/B testing,
Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data,
Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc),
Knowledge of visualisation tools like LookerStudio, Tableau, Looker or Qlikview,
Business Proficiency in English,
A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys having fun!



It would be a plus if you have:


R or Python programming skills (mostly for data extraction and data manipulation),
Google Analytics knowledge (as well as Google Analytics API, googleAnalyticsR library for R, GA4, etc.),
Knowledge on data structure and data sets management in Google Cloud Platform.
Previous experience programming.



What‚Äôs in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:

A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.

Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.

Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.

Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.

Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.

Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

HTML:
Associate Product Data Analyst - Experiments & Insights - (Hybrid)

As you contemplate your future, you might be asking yourself, what's the next step? Start your journey with us!

We're seeking a junior Product Data Analyst to join our Experiments & Insights team in Barcelona (hybrid) to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment. If you're ready to soar, we're ready to take you there.

Why eDreams ODIGEO

Join the world's leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe.

21 million customers ‚Äì 44 markets ‚Äì 5 brands ‚Äì 6.5M members in Prime

Over 1,600 employees ‚Äì More than 60 different nationalities from all continents

99% permanent contracts - 36 average age

We're the world‚Äôs leading travel subscription platform and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. We are a tech company revolutionizing the travel booking experience through our consumer insight, innovative technology, market leadership, and Prime, the world's first travel subscription program.

What you will do:

The Role's Key Responsibilities and Tasks

As an eDOer, you will have clear objectives, great challenges and a clear overview of how your work contributes to the global company project and its customers. Our Experiments and Insights team is the centre of excellence for Online (AB) Experimentation and for providing best practices to generate insights and learning from and for the experiments. As an Associate Product Data Analyst inside the team, you will be in charge of:

  • Analyse performance and identify behaviours in our different websites and interfaces related to our products;
  • Analyse performance and user behaviours in the A/B Tests experiments or Pre-Post run by the product teams;
  • Help the product teams to generate their testing hypotheses by providing exploratory analysis about our products, past tests, etc,
  • Data cleaning and validation,
  • Definition of new tracking that will all mostly be added in Google Analytics (to be able to answer different kinds of research/product questions);
  • Build and maintain dashboards (mostly using LookerStudio) and/or reports (mostly in Google Sheets) to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders;
  • Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge;
  • Responsible for one or more team‚Äôs projects such as the investigation and implementation of new methodologies, new data analysis techniques or the usage of new tools;
  • Collaborate with user researchers and designers to detect gaps in knowledge about our user; identify research opportunities to fill those gaps.


NOTE: Data you will be using could come from Google Analytics API or Google Analytics tables in BigQuery, other sources of data stored in BigQuery such as internal databases, customer service database, etc., as well as our data stored and accessible in Microstrategy.

What you need to succeed:

Good to have

Bring your unique perspective, speak up, and offer disruptive solutions. You'll have the opportunity to learn and grow while making a real impact on our team. Here's what you need to succeed:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline is a requirement (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.),
  • Minimum of 2 years experience in a role with strong analytical component,
  • Previous experience in user behavior analysis (product performance) using data from any of the following: Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics/Mix Panel/ Amplitude/Matomo/‚Ä¶
  • Strong knowledge of the math and statistical concepts behind A/B testing,
  • Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data,
  • Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc),
  • Knowledge of visualisation tools like LookerStudio, Tableau, Looker or Qlikview,
  • Business Proficiency in English,
  • A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys having fun!


It would be a plus if you have:

  • R or Python programming skills (mostly for data extraction and data manipulation),
  • Google Analytics knowledge (as well as Google Analytics API, googleAnalyticsR library for R, GA4, etc.),
  • Knowledge on data structure and data sets management in Google Cloud Platform.
  • Previous experience programming.


What‚Äôs in it for you?

The best talent deserves the best benefits

At eDO, we want you to be a part of our success story and great culture.

Here's what we offer:

A rewarding Compensation package! üí• Prime Plus membership, competitive salary and benefits package, including flexible benefits, performance-based bonuses, birthday day off, discounts and partnerships, relocation support and the possibility of choosing your equipment and, even better, keeping it for free after 3 years.

Continuous learning to fuel your growth and explore new horizons! üìö Learn and grow with free Coursera access, soft skills workshops, tech training, leadership development, and more. Plus, enjoy a great onboarding program.

Grow opportunities to empower your career, and unleash your potential! üöÄ Personalised career paths and the eVOLVE Program will help you discover, grow, and thrive. Internal mobility opportunities let you pursue horizontal career changes and promotions.

Your Well-being is our priority. Embrace Freedom and Flexibility! üíô At eDO, we value flexibility, employee care, and transparency. We offer a hybrid home-office model focused on outcome, not time-in-seat. You'll be able to find the right work-personal life balance that suits you best.

Work hard, party hard! We believe in having fun and connecting with colleagues! üéâ Join eDO for after-work events, padel tournaments, parties, and more. Create communities based on your passions, like sports and music. Come to work as you are, with no dress code, and enjoy free fruit, coffee, and tea at our offices.

Enjoy a dynamic and healthy environment! üí´ Be innovative, take risks, and share your ideas. Our diverse and open-minded teams support high performance, learning, and growth. You'll work in an Agile mindset environment with recognition at our core.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at eDO? Follow us on LinkedIn and discover more about life at eDO!

If you are ready for a career opportunity with unmatched benefits, continuous learning, and a supportive work-life balance, look no further! Take your career to new destinations by applying now and help our diverse, inclusive, and passionate team shape the future of travel.

Apply now!

We are an equal-opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status. Our people are the key to our success. Each one of them is unique in their own way and the respect for their uniqueness is and will always be a passion and motivation. Don‚Äôt meet every requirement? If you‚Äôre excited about this role but do not feel your experience aligns perfectly with all the requirements we strongly encourage you to apply nevertheless.

Title: Data Scientist - Product Analyst I Logistics (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: Building the largest marketplace in your city, to give access to anything in minutes. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the development of logistics features, quantifying the impact that they might bring to the company, supporting the design process with data to make decisions, coordinating the rollout of features, and measuring their impact.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with product and operations teams to define the product roadmap and strategy, monitor and give visibility of product metrics and KPIs.
Apply various advanced mathematical and statistical modeling techniques and analyses (A/B test, multivariate test, clustering, supervised learning, etc) to solve for product and business problems that drive the highest impact.
Translate product questions and hypotheses into analysis and actionable insights.
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Owning everything analytics end to end in the product development cycle, from ideation and opportunity sizing, to experimentation and post-launch impact analyses.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-3 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role, preferably in product facing teams
Knowledge or experience in digital product development
Experience with an application of statistical modeling and advanced analytics to provide product-shaping insights
Excellent SQL skills and experience applying those on-the-job; you know how to join multiple tables, you know how and when to use CTEs, and you use aggregate functions to come up with relevant statistics
Solid proficiency in programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledgeable and preferably experienced in designing and analyzing experiments in digital products (A/B test, multivariate, etc)
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Qlikview.
Excellent spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Description:

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
CONMED is a global medical technology company that specializes in the development and sale of surgical and patient monitoring products and services that allow our physician customers to deliver high quality care and as a result, enhanced clinical outcomes for their patients.




With products that are recognized as technological leaders by the specialties they serve, healthcare professionals within the Orthopaedic, Laparoscopic, Robotic & Open Surgery, Gastroenterology & Pulmonology and Cardiology & Critical Care specialties have come to value the CONMED name across the world.

Our broad portfolio focuses on the needs and wants of specific specialties while coming together at the point of care delivery to offer our customers the power of choice and the power of convenience.




Job Summary: We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team to join our International Finance Team. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to interpret complex data sets. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, processing, and analyzing data to provide actionable insights that support our business objectives.




Reporting to: Vice President Finance, International




Location: Barcelona, Spain or Lyon, France.




Key Responsibilities:

¬∑ Collect, clean, and validate data from various sources.

¬∑ Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.

¬∑ Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data.

¬∑ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and deliver solutions.

¬∑ Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling.

¬∑ Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.

¬∑ Monitor data quality and ensure data integrity.

¬∑ Prepare ad-hoc analysis, reports and presentations

¬∑ Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis.




Qualifications:

¬∑ Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.

¬∑ Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.

¬∑ Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., SQL, Python, R, Excel).

¬∑ Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI), ERP (e.g. Oracle, SAP) and Salesforce.com.

¬∑ Proficiency in Microsoft Office.

¬∑ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

¬∑ Excellent communication and presentation skills.

¬∑ Attention to detail and a high level of accuracy.

¬∑ Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

¬∑ English, as primary work language . Any other European language is a plus




Preferred Qualifications:

¬∑ Master's degree in a related field.

¬∑ Experience with machine learning and predictive analytics.

¬∑ Knowledge of database management and data warehousing.




Team & Main Interactions:

¬∑ Reporting to International Finance Team

¬∑ Frequent contact with the sales, marketing and finance team from our international subsidiaries

¬∑ Work in close partnership with the Corporate IT Team




Benefits:

¬∑ Competitive salary and benefits package.

¬∑ Opportunities for professional development and growth.

¬∑ Collaborative and inclusive work environment.

¬∑ Flexible work hours and remote work options.

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.

Key Responsibilities:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies
Use Excels skills to accomplish tasks of more complex nature (vlookups, pivot tables, IF conditions..)
Ensure data accuracy
Improve operations/processes for the team by identifying trends
Implement consumer data acquisition, e-commerce analytics and trigger-based marketing
Implement consumer analytics, consumer segmentation and profiling
Respond to data analysis requests from stakeholders and staff members
Retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and uploading the information to various sources
Help with Daily, Weekly, Monthly & Annual reporting
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality
Defining the data quality standards in the context of the specific initiatives
Maintain functional expertise in database analytics best practices and the tools that support them
Work with cross-functional teams such as engineering, product management, business intelligence to deploy data quality across critical pipelines and to set up processes to triage data issues
Create and optimise metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor data quality for our most critical data assets
Effectively and timely communicate data quality insights and drive projects to improve data quality
Research data sources and make any corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the information being recorded
Real time data analyst, monitoring and identifying performance drops using analytics tools to ensure timely resolution and maintain optimal product functionality.
Reviewing data control alerts, ensuring that processes operate effectively and efficiently, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues



Requirements

What will make you stand out from the crowd:


BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field.
Excellent judgement, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills
Extremely detailed oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical problem solving skill
Advanced Expertise in MS Excel and Google sheet required
Preferred knowledge/experience with Analytics Platform and SQL
Knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have., ideally with experience in international environments
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have



Benefits

Perks of being one of us:


Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean



Sounds good? Apply now!

We're looking forward to getting to know you :)

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.
