Title: Data Analyst
Description:
EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling videogame franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences. EA SPORTS creates connected experiences that ignite the emotion of sport through industry-leading sports video games, including EA SPORTS Madden NFL, FC, NHL, NBA LIVE, PGA TOUR and UFC.

There are millions of EA SPORTS players generating billions of events every day. We are using the high-volume data streams to detect and anticipate Security threats and issues as soon as they occur. The Game Security Data Analyst will be an essential EA SPORTS Security Team member. Reporting to the Development Director - Game Security, you will support the SOC lead and the Security Data Scientists by ensuring partners can receive and understand relevant information promptly to help keep our Sports games safe and secure.This is a hybrid role that is located in Madrid.

Responsibilities


Analyse data to support business decisions and security operations
Develop business intelligence and reporting solutions
Communicate findings, issues and trade-offs to team members
Adopt a security mindset to predict the adversary's moves and ensure the right Data is available to detect them.
Think and solve complex data problems in a maintainable and scalable fashion


Required Qualifications


2 years experience
Proficiency with SQL and no-SQL databases.
Knowledge and experience with data gathering, analysis, and visualization tools
Some knowledge and experience working with Python
Experience with data visualizations in tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About REVER

Shoppers receive any purchase in 24h anywhere on the planet. Why can‚Äôt we also return & get refunded just as quickly? REVER is born to change how the world buys by giving superpowers to shoppers, because returning should be as easy as buying. We automate returns, refunds, and exchanges for ecommerce businesses across the globe. After being backed by Y-Combinator, market leading VCs and top founders from unicorns in Europe, we are now growing 10x yearly and expanding to more and more countries. To accelerate our growth even further, we are looking for game-changers to join our team.

We are like a sports team; we create an environment where everyone can give their max and we push each other to achieve our potential. We are data driven problem solvers, but most importantly fast learners. You‚Äôll immerse yourself in a vibrant, youthful atmosphere with a lot of potential to grow internally.

You Will


Be part of the Product Automations team at REVER, which is in the center of Logistics, Operations, Finance, Data Analytics and Tech teams.
Be involved in the product and roadmap definition process to solve customer needs.
Interact with REVER clients and REVER internal Teams to understand their requests, needs & priorities
Make data-driven decisions to prioritize initiatives and be fast on their execution.
Implement solutions to our core product (both internal and external)
Build MVPs to validate new business opportunities


You Have


Analytical and data-driven mindset
Curious and open to challenge/ be challenged
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to solve problems and make quick and effective decisions
Ready to engage yourself 100% in this adventure
You are a team player who inspires trust, are ready to take the initiative, and is distinguished by a customer-satisfaction-driven attitude;
You are interested in a start-up environment, you are proactive and ready to share your ideas to continue building the best product in the market


Why join us


Be at the forefront of scaling REVER.
Join a fast-growing, dynamic company with strong backing from top-tier investors.
Work alongside an international, passionate team in the heart of Barcelona.
Help shape the future of e-commerce and revolutionize the returns experience for customers around Europe.

HTML:
About REVER

Shoppers receive any purchase in 24h anywhere on the planet. Why can‚Äôt we also return & get refunded just as quickly? REVER is born to change how the world buys by giving superpowers to shoppers, because returning should be as easy as buying. We automate returns, refunds, and exchanges for ecommerce businesses across the globe. After being backed by Y-Combinator, market leading VCs and top founders from unicorns in Europe, we are now growing 10x yearly and expanding to more and more countries. To accelerate our growth even further, we are looking for game-changers to join our team.

We are like a sports team; we create an environment where everyone can give their max and we push each other to achieve our potential. We are data driven problem solvers, but most importantly fast learners. You‚Äôll immerse yourself in a vibrant, youthful atmosphere with a lot of potential to grow internally.

You Will

  • Be part of the Product Automations team at REVER, which is in the center of Logistics, Operations, Finance, Data Analytics and Tech teams.
  • Be involved in the product and roadmap definition process to solve customer needs.
  • Interact with REVER clients and REVER internal Teams to understand their requests, needs & priorities
  • Make data-driven decisions to prioritize initiatives and be fast on their execution.
  • Implement solutions to our core product (both internal and external)
  • Build MVPs to validate new business opportunities

You Have

  • Analytical and data-driven mindset
  • Curious and open to challenge/ be challenged
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Ability to solve problems and make quick and effective decisions
  • Ready to engage yourself 100% in this adventure
  • You are a team player who inspires trust, are ready to take the initiative, and is distinguished by a customer-satisfaction-driven attitude;
  • You are interested in a start-up environment, you are proactive and ready to share your ideas to continue building the best product in the market

Why join us

  • Be at the forefront of scaling REVER.
  • Join a fast-growing, dynamic company with strong backing from top-tier investors.
  • Work alongside an international, passionate team in the heart of Barcelona.
  • Help shape the future of e-commerce and revolutionize the returns experience for customers around Europe.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You Lead the Way. We‚Äôve Got Your Back.

With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you‚Äôll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that‚Äôs unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.

At American Express, you‚Äôll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact‚Äîevery colleague has the opportunity to share in the company‚Äôs success. Together, we‚Äôll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world‚Äôs best customer experience every day. And we‚Äôll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.

Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.
How will you make an impact in this role?

We are hiring for a highly motivated and versatile Data Analyst, integrated in the Data Analytics & Insights Team, based in Madrid, Spain. The successful candidate will be a key player on the ICS Commercial & Consumer strategy and is integrated within a team that support different Continental' Europe markets. In this position the candidate must think strategically to maintain and develop tools which will help ICS Commercial & Consumer teams to identify business growing opportunities and maximize their productivity.

The main responsibilities will be:

Maintain the reporting infrastructure for the Business by leveraging our existing systems and databases.

Extract & Analyze data ‚Äì Maintain/Develop business insights to gain understanding on portfolio performance: identify trends in activation, attrition, activity level, etc.

Maintain/Create Tools to help Sales Team to boost performance

Key player in the planning and strategy processes

Propose recommendations to solve problems

Put in place robust processes to deliver new daily/weekly or monthly reporting, ad hoc analysis, trigger-based models and results using advanced python and SQL code


Minimum Qualifications:

Valid Spanish / EU work permit

Bachelor (or equivalent) in Mathematics / Engineering / Computer Science (or similar)

At least 1 year of work experience (if on the Data Analytics area it will be a plus)

Advanced Python & SQL Programmer

Advanced Excel or Access with Macros

Strong analytical mindset

Fast Learner

Ability to drive results while working on multiple projects with multiple stakeholders and in changing environments
Excellent English language communication skills, both verbal and written.

Preferred Qualifications:

Linux/VB/JS & other programming languages will be a plus.

Knowledge of Microsoft Power Automate Platform

Project Management experience


We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:
Competitive base salaries¬†
Bonus incentives¬†
Support for financial-well-being and retirement¬†
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits (depending on location)¬†
Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need¬†
Generous paid parental leave policies (depending on your location)¬†
Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)¬†
Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program¬†
Career development and training opportunities

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work from Home Policy‚ÄØand‚ÄØWFH Parent Policy: Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A Little Bit About Us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:


Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards



Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
Proactive attitude and results-oriented



Benefits

Perks of being one of us


Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks


Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

  • Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards


Requirements

  • Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
  • Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
  • Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry
  • Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
  • In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms
  • Experience working with data visualization tools
  • Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc
  • Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
  • Proactive attitude and results-oriented


Benefits

Perks of being one of us

  • Full-time, permanent contract
  • Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
  • Remote work
  • Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
  • Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
  • Enhanced career path designed just for you
  • External training budget
  • We celebrate all company landmarks

Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data Analyst (Full remote within Spain)
Description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of working on multiple deliverables in parallel, and be comfortable receiving reporting requirements and translating these into solutions. In addition to, prioritizing and communicating progress and blockers effectively.

Key Responsibilities:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies
Use Excels skills to accomplish tasks of more complex nature (vlookups, pivot tables, IF conditions..)
Ensure data accuracy
Improve operations/processes for the team by identifying trends
Implement consumer data acquisition, e-commerce analytics and trigger-based marketing
Implement consumer analytics, consumer segmentation and profiling
Respond to data analysis requests from stakeholders and staff members
Retrieving data, cleaning and preparing data for analysis, performing data analysis, and uploading the information to various sources
Help with Daily, Weekly, Monthly & Annual reporting
Perform analysis on large data sets using appropriate data analysis techniques and tools with a strong focus on quality
Defining the data quality standards in the context of the specific initiatives
Maintain functional expertise in database analytics best practices and the tools that support them
Work with cross-functional teams such as engineering, product management, business intelligence to deploy data quality across critical pipelines and to set up processes to triage data issues
Create and optimise metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor data quality for our most critical data assets
Effectively and timely communicate data quality insights and drive projects to improve data quality
Research data sources and make any corrections to existing data as needed to ensure accuracy of the information being recorded
Real time data analyst, monitoring and identifying performance drops using analytics tools to ensure timely resolution and maintain optimal product functionality.
Reviewing data control alerts, ensuring that processes operate effectively and efficiently, enabling proactive identification and resolution of data issues



Requirements

What will make you stand out from the crowd:


BA/BS in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business or analytical field.
Excellent judgement, critical-thinking, and decision-making skills
Extremely detailed oriented
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Strong analytical problem solving skill
Advanced Expertise in MS Excel and Google sheet required
Preferred knowledge/experience with Analytics Platform and SQL
Knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have., ideally with experience in international environments
Good knowledge of Amplitude is nice to have



Benefits

Perks of being one of us:


Top-notch private health insurance ‚Äî includes dental and psychological services
Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work OR come into the office if you prefer!
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
Other: ticket restaurant, nursery tickets
Budget for team-building activities
We celebrate all company landmarks
And when you come into the office, you'll get free coffee and snacks, fresh fruit, and can enjoy our game room and the cool terrace overlooking the Mediterranean



Sounds good? Apply now!

We're looking forward to getting to know you :)

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Global Media Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary

The Global Measure team is looking for a candidate for the position of Global Media Data Analyst. His/her knowledge of online media combined with his/her analytical skills will shape the core of his/her responsibilities.




The Global Media Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring the technical feasibility of product enhancements and new developments for Reporting and Measurement projects and tools, as well as being a tech liaison between the Product Owner and IT teams. Reporting directly to the Product Owner, this role will bridge the gap between strategic product vision and technical implementation, collaborating with IT teams while providing in-depth technical guidance within the Product team.




S/He will work with the Global Product Owner, and Global IT in the business and technical definition of Reporting and Measurement tools and projects.
S/He will support the Product team to align business requirements with functional and technical specification and architecture.
S/He provides data expertise and works closely with the Product Owner, and other HAVAS technical teams.
S/He contributes to the continuous improvement of working practices, application quality, tooling and agile processes.




Mission & Responsibilities

Functional:

Technical Feasibility Analysis:

Assess and validate technical viability of Reporting and Measurement tools and projects.
Identify risks and suggest efficiency improvements and scalability for Reporting and Measurement tools and projects, and their technical frameworks.
Provide technical recommendations for enhancements and new developments within the existing tech stack, as well as potential integrations with other tools to optimize performance
Liaise between Product team and IT for seamless handoffs, and support IT implementation.




Media Expertise in Measurement and Reporting:

Leverage an in-depth understanding of media and campaign reporting processes to translate a business brief into a tech brief and guide data integration, visualization, and reporting requirements for market and client implementation.
Understand and collaborate on definition of KPI frameworks, naming conventions, data mapping, and schema design.




Data Governance and Best Practices:

Work with the Product Owner in defining and developing best practices for data governance, including mapping and transformation.




Technical & Data Expertise:

Experience:

4 to 6 years in a technical role within media, marketing, or campaign reporting domains, demonstrating a strong understanding of omnichannel planning and measurement frameworks.
Demonstrated experience in defining projects using reporting tools such as Power BI and Tableau, as well as working with cloud-based platforms like Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Microsoft Azure.
Experience with Data Extraction and Aggregation Tools: Proven familiarity and hands-on experience with platforms like Funnel, Supermetrics, Datorama, or similar tools for extracting, aggregating, and integrating data from multiple sources to support reporting and analytics.




Familiarity with key Digital Marketing data sources such as:

Google Marketing Platform (Google Ads, CM360, DV360, SA360).
Social Platforms (Facebook Ads, Business Manager, Sprinklr, Paragone, TikTok, Twitter, Snapchat).
Other DSPs (Xandr, Adobe Advertising Cloud, Teads, The Trade Desk, Sizmek).
Verification Tools (DoubleVerify, IAS).




Technical Skills:

Expertise in Power BI, Excel, Power Query, SQL, GCP (BigQuery).
Strong understanding of data mapping, ETL processes, and naming conventions.




Soft Skills & Competencies

Excellent English ‚Äì written and spoken.
Problem-solving mindset focused on scalable solutions.
Good interpersonal and written/oral communication skills.
Proactive and ability to initiate.
Good analytical problem-solving skills.
Positive, persistent, and can-do attitude.
Show more

  • Experience with Data Extraction and Aggregation Tools: Proven familiarity and hands-on experience with platforms like Funnel, Supermetrics, Datorama, or similar tools for extracting, aggregating, and integrating data from multiple sources to support reporting and analytics.


Familiarity with key Digital Marketing data sources such as:

  • Google Marketing Platform (Google Ads, CM360, DV360, SA360).
  • Social Platforms (Facebook Ads, Business Manager, Sprinklr, Paragone, TikTok, Twitter, Snapchat).
  • Other DSPs (Xandr, Adobe Advertising Cloud, Teads, The Trade Desk, Sizmek).
  • Verification Tools (DoubleVerify, IAS).


Technical Skills:

  • Expertise in Power BI, Excel, Power Query, SQL, GCP (BigQuery).
  • Strong understanding of data mapping, ETL processes, and naming conventions.


Soft Skills & Competencies

  • Excellent English ‚Äì written and spoken.
  • Problem-solving mindset focused on scalable solutions.
  • Good interpersonal and written/oral communication skills.
  • Proactive and ability to initiate.
  • Good analytical problem-solving skills.
  • Positive, persistent, and can-do attitude.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are:

At Emburse, you‚Äôll not just imagine the future ‚Äì you‚Äôll build it. As a leader in travel and expense solutions, we are creating a future where technology drives business value and inspires extraordinary results.

We are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst to join the Emburse Marketing team. This person will help the team to enhance their campaigns by using data to create actionable i nsights.

Using Salesforce CRM to track both online and offline campaigns, this role will create self-service tools and provide enablement to ensure the whole team knows and understands the data. A deep understanding of the digital marketing landscape and the full marketing funnel is essential to excel in this position.

An ideal candidate will possess exceptional stakeholder management skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex data in a clear and easy-to-understand manner and is fluent not only in Salesforce CRM, but also ideally has skills with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Lookr.

What You Will Do


Conduct data analysis and provide insights to enable Marketers to optimize their campaigns.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements and translate them into data analysis solutions (from ad-hoc reports and self-service dashboards).
Use Tableau or Looker studio to design and build easy-to-use dashboards, often connecting multiple data sources.
Present complex data to a broad audience, with varying levels of data literacy, in a manner that is clear and actionable.
Develop and automate reports, dashboards, and visualizations to effectively communicate findings and trends.
Provide education and training to Marketers so they can self-service and understand our various marketing metrics.
Partner with the web experience team to design and measure digital experiments (AB tests) based on user behaviors and UX research.
Collaborate with stakeholders to create targets and provide forecasts for key performance indicators (KPIs).
Conduct ad-hoc analysis and provide actionable insights to support business initiatives and solve complex problems.
Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to analyze complex datasets.


What We Are Looking For


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and with Executives.
Proficiency with the Salesforce CRM suite for data analysis and visualizations such as Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Data Cloud
Hand-on experience with data manipulation in Excel/Google Sheets and visualization tools such as Tableau and Looker Studio.
Commercial acumen, ideally around SaaS B2B Sales and Marketing data.
Data cleaning and preparation using tools such as Coefficient or Tableau Prep.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities.
Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills

HTML:
Who We Are:

At Emburse, you‚Äôll not just imagine the future ‚Äì you‚Äôll build it. As a leader in travel and expense solutions, we are creating a future where technology drives business value and inspires extraordinary results.

We are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst to join the Emburse Marketing team. This person will help the team to enhance their campaigns by using data to create actionable i nsights.

Using Salesforce CRM to track both online and offline campaigns, this role will create self-service tools and provide enablement to ensure the whole team knows and understands the data. A deep understanding of the digital marketing landscape and the full marketing funnel is essential to excel in this position.

An ideal candidate will possess exceptional stakeholder management skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex data in a clear and easy-to-understand manner and is fluent not only in Salesforce CRM, but also ideally has skills with data visualization tools such as Tableau and Lookr.

What You Will Do

  • Conduct data analysis and provide insights to enable Marketers to optimize their campaigns.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements and translate them into data analysis solutions (from ad-hoc reports and self-service dashboards).
  • Use Tableau or Looker studio to design and build easy-to-use dashboards, often connecting multiple data sources.
  • Present complex data to a broad audience, with varying levels of data literacy, in a manner that is clear and actionable.
  • Develop and automate reports, dashboards, and visualizations to effectively communicate findings and trends.
  • Provide education and training to Marketers so they can self-service and understand our various marketing metrics.
  • Partner with the web experience team to design and measure digital experiments (AB tests) based on user behaviors and UX research.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to create targets and provide forecasts for key performance indicators (KPIs).
  • Conduct ad-hoc analysis and provide actionable insights to support business initiatives and solve complex problems.
  • Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to analyze complex datasets.

What We Are Looking For

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively across teams and with Executives.
  • Proficiency with the Salesforce CRM suite for data analysis and visualizations such as Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud and Data Cloud
  • Hand-on experience with data manipulation in Excel/Google Sheets and visualization tools such as Tableau and Looker Studio.
  • Commercial acumen, ideally around SaaS B2B Sales and Marketing data.
  • Data cleaning and preparation using tools such as Coefficient or Tableau Prep.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities.
  • Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills

Why Emburse?

Finance is changing‚Äîand at Emburse, we‚Äôre leading the way. Our AI-powered solutions help organizations eliminate inefficiencies, gain real-time visibility, and optimize spend‚Äîso they can focus on what‚Äôs next, not what‚Äôs slowing them down.

  • A Company with Momentum ‚Äì We serve 12M+ users across 120 countries, helping businesses modernize

their finance operations.

  • A Team That Innovates ‚Äì Work alongside some of the brightest minds in finance, tech, and AI to solve real-

world challenges.

  • A Culture That Empowers ‚Äì Competitive pay, flexible work, and an inclusive, collaborative environment that

supports your success.

  • A Career That Matters ‚Äì Your work here drives efficiency, innovation, and smarter financial decision-making

for businesses everywhere.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft‚Äôs 19,000 team members, working across more than 30 countries around the world, are bound by a common mission to enrich players‚Äô lives with original and memorable gaming experiences. Their commitment and talent have brought to life many acclaimed franchises such as Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Far Cry, Watch Dogs, Just Dance, Rainbow Six, and many more to come. Ubisoft is an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds and perspectives are key to creating worlds where both players and teams can thrive and express themselves. If you are excited about solving game-changing challenges, cutting edge technologies and pushing the boundaries of entertainment, we invite you to join our journey and help us create the unknown.

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team. This person will report to the Live Producer. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid Work from Home Policy‚ÄØand‚ÄØWFH Parent Policy: Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flex working schedule:‚ÄØ40hrs per week with start time between 8 AM ‚Äì 10 AM and leave from 5 PM (Friday from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 200‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (Remote)
Description:
We're looking for a Marketing Data Analyst who is passionate about their work, adapts easily, and shares our company values!

A Little Bit About Us

Leadtech has been fostering and developing innovative digital businesses across several industries since 2009. It has since then expanded to a team of over 500 committed employees working all over Spain. We are thrilled to have more than 23 nationalities working together and very proud to see that our products and services are enjoyed by millions of users monthly around the globe.

How you will make a difference:


Measure the performance of marketing campaigns, build ad hoc custom reports, and analyze anomalies and trends
Preparation of analytical reports and dashboards (including visualization) for the marketing team
Creation of Google Sheets scripts to connect data from different reports and Google Sheets
High experience and skill level in Microsoft Excel / Google Sheets
Analysis of product & marketing metrics correlation and identification of their drivers
Analysis and identification of user behavior patterns based on product & marketing analytics and forming hypotheses for the marketing team based on these insights
Develop the SKAN measurement approach for Google, Meta and Tiktok
Deeply understand the process of acquisition of users in order to analyze/provide valuable proposals
Manage MMP Tools (Adjust), and provide technical support and troubleshooting for the marketing team, specifically related to app attribution, event tracking, and callback implementations
Analyze performance impact of any product and marketing strategy changes
Cooperate with Marketing and Product teams to actively increase project profitability
Collaborate with the BI department to create and maintain data visualization dashboards



Requirements


Bachelor degree in STEM field or similar
Experience working as Analyst of at least 3 years
Strong knowledge of app attribution tools commonly used in the mobile advertising industry
Strong knowledge of machine learning and statistics techniques
Strong communication skills and the ability to translate technical findings into clear business recommendations
In-depth understanding of digital marketing strategies including down funnel analysis, as well technical knowledge of iOS and Android marketing analysis to tailor strategies for both platforms
Experience working with data visualization tools
Experience with setting up and managing event tracking in mobile apps. Especially with a focus on SKAN, Firebase, Meta etc
Teamwork and collaboration skills to work closely with other data professionals and cross-functional teams
Proactive attitude and results-oriented



Benefits

Perks of being one of us


Full-time, permanent contract
Flexible time off, no blackout dates, plus your birthday, Christmas' Eve and New Year's Eve off
Remote work
Flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. / 3:30 - 7:30 p.m)
Free Friday afternoons (a 7-hour workday!) + 35-hour week in July and August (free afternoons here we come!)
Enhanced career path designed just for you
External training budget
We celebrate all company landmarks


Sounds good? Apply now! We're looking forward to getting to know you.

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expressi√≥n and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be a part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

Title: Data analyst - (Remote - Europe/EU)
Description:
Jobgether has ALL remote jobs globally. We match you to roles where you're most likely to succeed, and provide feedback on every application to help you learn. No more guesswork, application black holes, or recruiter ghosting in your job search.

For one of our clients, we are looking for a Data Analyst (Monochains, Multinetwork, and Cosmos Hub Ecosystem), remotely from Europe.

In this role, you will work with a dynamic and innovative team focused on exploring blockchain ecosystems to identify opportunities and risks. Your responsibilities will involve developing end-to-end data solutions, from initial analysis to deployment, with a strong focus on optimization, scalability, and performance. You'll provide valuable insights to the team and community through informative dashboards, while also improving validation processes and working closely with the data engineering team. This is a fantastic opportunity to shape the future of decentralized finance with cutting-edge technologies.

Accountabilities:


Explore blockchain ecosystems, identifying potential opportunities and risks related to Monochains, Multinetwork, and Cosmos Hub
Design and develop comprehensive data solutions, from analysis to deployment, ensuring performance optimization and scalability
Build and maintain informative dashboards for internal teams, the company, and the wider community
Collaborate with data engineering teams to define data requirements, and ensure proper granularity, frequency, and data quality
Manage and govern team data marts, ensuring data lineage and providing actionable insights
Provide ad-hoc support to team members to address emerging data needs



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
Proficiency in advanced SQL (including joins and window expressions) and experience with Google BigQuery
Competence in analytical programming languages such as Python, with experience in the analytical stack
Experience with ETL tools like Airflow and dbt
Advanced knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Superset, Looker)
Strong skills in data research, probability theory, and mathematical statistics, including regressions and A/B testing
Proven ability to tell compelling data stories and present your analysis with clear insights
Familiarity with cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology is a plus
Proficiency in English (B2+ or higher)



Benefits


Competitive salary, with the option to receive payments in cryptocurrency
Well-being program and mental health care support
Compensation for educational programs, including foreign language courses and professional development
Reimbursement for equipment and co-working spaces
Opportunities to attend overseas conferences and engage with the global community
Positive, friendly, and collaborative communication culture
P2P.org is an equal opportunity employer, offering a diverse and inclusive work environment

Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.

Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English

  • Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
  • Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English


What we offer:


  • Challenges in an international environment
  • Career development opportunities
  • Internal training catalogue
  • Permanent contract
  • Private medical care
  • Comprehensive onboarding program
  • Buddy
  • Scandinavian work culture
  • Work-life balance
  • Culture of feedback
  • Work schedule 35h/week
  • Hybrid and flexible work
  • Good access to public transports

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Responsibilities

  • Work with stakeholders to review and update Bill of Materials (BOMs);
  • Extract and analyze data from SAP, ensuring consistency in receipts and raw materials;
  • Collaborate with the operations team to resolve issues and errors;
  • Improve quality documentation and automate processes where possible;
  • Propose enhancements and test new tools as needed;
  • Generate reports and track key metrics;
  • Ensure on-site presence in Lisbon at least once per week, ideally more.

Requirements

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in data analysis;
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Google solutions;
  • Experience working in an international context, preferably with American stakeholders;
  • Experience in data analysis for industrial areas;
  • Strong project management skills, particularly in IT and change management;
  • Knowledge of Product Stewardship and SAP EHS is a plus;
  • Excellent communication skills in both English and Portuguese.

Title: BI Reporting Analyst
Description:
Overview

As the BI Reporting Analyst, you will be responsible for building and maintaining reports and dashboards required across the organization within PowerBI and Salesforce. As part of this role, you will gather requirements from across the organization on reporting requirements, and build out our corporate standardized reporting infrastructure providing accurate, timely, and targeted insights to support data driven decision making. This role will form a central part of our Sales Operations department at HVD Group, where you will be in close contact with leaders, and sellers across the organization, who will rely on you to support them with key insights to their business. This is an exciting opportunity to build and optimize our reporting infrastructure from the ground up, all adding to our hyper growth and expansion across the Nordics and Germany!

Responsibilities


Partner with leadership teams to identify bottlenecks in processes and implement solutions to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
Develop and maintain scalable reporting and dashboarding tools in Salesforce, PowerBI and other business intelligence platforms.
Analyze sales, marketing, and customer success data to provide actionable insights and support data driven decision making.
As a fast growing company, with numerous ongoing acquisitions ‚Äì develop and support interim, and ad hoc reporting requirements where direct data linkages may not yet exists.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to align efforts, ensuring a seamless end-to-end customer journey.
Lead initiatives to streamline workflows, reduce friction in the sales process, and enhance data quality.
Collaborate with our developers and business systems teams to manage and optimize our Salesforce and PowerBI applications.
Stay informed about industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in revenue



Qualifications


Quantitative degree (Business Intelligence, Mathematics, Engineering, or similar)
2-5 years of experience delivering actionable analytics in a complex, fast-paced environment and/or in a combination of strategy and operations roles preferably related to revenue operations.
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with PowerBI reporting and dashboarding.
Ideally with Salesforce reporting / dashboarding experience
Exceptional analytical skills with a proven track record of using data to drive decision-making.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
A collaborative mindset and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ideally familiarity with SaaS business models and an understanding of sales and marketing operations.



If you share our excitement and vision but worry that your experience doesn't match all the listed qualifications, please apply anyway! You could be the ideal candidate for this role despite lacking a year or two, or perhaps for another role in our ever-expanding organisation We look forward to your application!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities


Main responsible for Business requirement gathering, User Story writing, and leading User Story refinement / Solution design efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery.
Proactively capture and understand Business processes and suggest improvements to the Data Platform that benefit the organization.


Essential Skills


At least 5 years' experience in a similar role;
Proven experience with data projects related to accounting, planning and financial analysis domains;
Solid knowledge of data analysis and programming with SQL and Python;
Good knowledge of understanding REST/API SOAP APIs;
Good ability to create prototypes to support requirements in Power BI;
Good knowledge of English.


What Do I Need Before I Apply

This project is remote but you must live in Portugal.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Department: CX Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Reporting To: Fedor Suslyaev

Description

As a Senior Data Analyst in the Customer Experience (CX) Quality Assurance (QA) domain, you will play a critical role in driving data-driven decision-making to enhance the quality of customer support operations. You will analyze data related to agent performance, customer satisfaction (CSAT) surveys, and other key metrics to identify trends, uncover insights, and recommend actionable improvements. Your work will directly impact the quality of customer interactions, agent performance, and overall customer satisfaction.

This role requires a strong analytical mindset, expertise in data analysis tools, and a deep understanding of customer experience metrics. You will collaborate closely with QA teams, customer support managers, and other stakeholders to ensure data insights are translated into effective strategies for improving customer experience.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Reporting:


Analyze data related to agents quality scores, QAs performance, QA queue of tasks, CSAT surveys etc.
Create comprehensive reports and dashboards to visualize key metrics and insights for stakeholders.



Quality Assurance Insights:


Identify patterns and trends in QA data to uncover root causes of quality issues.
Provide actionable recommendations to improve agent performance and customer interactions.
Monitor the impact of QA initiatives and track progress over time.



Collaboration with Stakeholders:


Work closely with QA teams, customer support managers, and training teams to share insights and drive data-informed decisions.
Partner with IT and data engineering teams to ensure data accuracy, accessibility, and relevance.



Process Improvement:


Identify inefficiencies in QA processes and recommend improvements to enhance data collection and analysis.
Develop and implement new metrics or KPIs to better measure agent performance and customer satisfaction.



Predictive and Prescriptive Analysis:


Use advanced analytics techniques to predict trends in agent quality and customer satisfaction.
Provide prescriptive recommendations to proactively address potential issues before they impact customer experience.



Skills, Knowledge & Expertise


Work experience as a data analyst for 3+ years.
Advanced knowledge of SQL, Python.
Experience using Tableau/Metabase or similar data visualization tools.
Experience with using GPT/Claude as a tool for work tasks solving.
A structured approach to problem solving alongside strong quantitative skills. You can analyze issues, identify root-causes and recommend solutions.
Ability to come up with hypotheses and ways to improve our processes: backed by data if possible, but also by your expertise and common sense.
Verbal and written communication skills, an ability to interact with business and product teams.
At least upper-intermediate English proficiency.

Title: Business Data Analyst (m / f / d) ‚Äì Acquisition Marketing
Description:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Data Analyst to join our BI Team, with a dedicated focus on Acquisition Marketing. In this role, you will apply your expertise in data analysis, SaaS B2B Business, and marketing metrics to deliver actionable insights that drive lead generation and marketing campaign success. Proficiency in SQL and Power BI (Looker is a plus) is essential, and experience in Python is a strong advantage. You will play a pivotal role in bridging technical data analysis with business-oriented decision-making.

Your Tasks


Act as a dedicated BI partner to the Demand Generation team, analyzing data and providing insights to optimize lead generation, campaign performance, and customer acquisition strategies.
Design, develop, and maintain dashboards and reports using Power BI or Looker, ensuring stakeholders have access to metrics and actionable insights.
Prepare and present detailed reports and dashboards tailored to business stakeholders, ensuring data-driven decision-making during reporting discussions.
Leverage SaaS B2B Business to perform in-depth analyses, generate reports, and support strategic decision-making processes tailored to B2B marketing and sales.
Monitor and analyze key demand generation metrics, including Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC), Lead Conversion Rates, Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLs), Sales Qualified Leads (SQLs), Lifetime Value (LTV), campaign ROI, CAC:Payback, etc
Use SQL to query and manipulate large datasets, ensuring accuracy and consistency in reporting.
Utilize Python (if applicable) for advanced data analysis, automation, and predictive modeling to enhance demand generation strategies.
Collaborate with stakeholders to transform data findings into actionable recommendations and track their implementation and results.
Stay updated on industry trends, B2B marketing best practices, and new tools to continuously improve demand generation efforts.


You Bring


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Data Analytics, Marketing, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on B2B business and marketing insights.
Proficiency in SaaS B2B Business for data analysis and reporting.
Advanced skills in SQL for querying and analyzing data. Python is a plus
Strong expertise in Power BI for creating dashboards and data visualizations.
Solid understanding of demand generation metrics and marketing KPIs, such as CTR, CPC, and customer journey analysis.
Strong business acumen, with the ability to connect data insights to strategic business decisions.
Excellent communication skills, capable of presenting findings clearly to non-technical stakeholders.


Don‚Äôt meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Usercentrics we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we‚Äôre happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths ‚Äî so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.

Title: Business, Data Analytics and Insights Associate
Description:
Join our team at AMGEN Capability Center Portugal, number 1 company in Best Workplaces - https://www.greatplacetowork.pt/ - ranking in

Portugal (category 201-500 employees) by the Great Place to Work Institute. We have a team of over 300 talented people and more than 35

different nationalities, diverse areas of expertise and professional experience that are shaping the future of healthcare. This is your chance to

explore a world of opportunities in different areas such as Cybersecurity, Data & Analytics, Digital, Technology and Innovation, Finance,

General & Admin, Human Resources, Regulatory Affairs and many more. In Lisbon's city center, our AMGEN office fosters innovation,

excellence, and inspiration. Come thrive with us at AMGEN, supporting our mission To Serve Patients. What we do at AMGEN matters in

people‚Äôs lives.

Associate Field Excellence

LIVE

What You Will Do

You, as our Associate Field Excellence, will support the delivery of day to day D&A activities and delivery of sales and activities data to the country teams. The responsibilities include development and maintenance of data model and reporting in Tableau, resource planning and business analysis, performance tracking and monitoring, territory management and data quality and support for the wider business Units within ACCP and Amgen.

Some of the tasks related to that are:


Maintaining internal databases (master data, data validation, etc.)
Developing new and existing data models that are tailored to create insights about the sales of Amgen‚Äôs products.
Providing support on the internal CRM system
Using reporting and data visualization tools (Tableau) to develop new and maintain existing reporting dashboards and to deliver insight and drive action for the affiliate teams
Build data governance with scalable processes, refresh scheduling, security, and monitoring of report quality
Providing training and support on the internal CRM system.
Providing support on Plan of Action (POA) and SIP (Sales Incentive Plan) processes.
Support on capacity calculation and territories
Write Technical documentation of data models and applications
Field force sizing, targeting and efficacy/effectiveness
Supporting ACCP continuous improvement activities.
Supporting wider business units on an ad hoc basis (Finance/FP&A/Business Enablement).


WIN

What We Expect Of You

Our ideal candidate is a team player with customer focus. He/she is problem solving and result oriented and has time and process management skills and can compile data.

Proven experience and skills needed:


University Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Healthcare, Business or Data
1+ years‚Äô experience with reporting / data analyst / data integration role with increasing responsibilities and scope
Strong knowledge of MS Office tools (Excel and PPT)
Fluency in English, both in written and oral communication
Consistent track record of achieving desired results
Persuasive, resilient and problem solver
Communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Medium knowledge of Tableau or other similar BI tool
Medium to High knowledge of SQL


Preferred Requirements:


Working knowledge of IS systems (including demonstrated capability of Excel and other MS Office applications, VBA).
Demonstrates a service-minded attitude.
Knowledge of at least one ETL (Alteryx and Tableau Prep preferred)
Experience in the Pharmaceutical industry.
Fluency in Italian both written and oral


THRIVE

What You Can Expect Of Us


Vast opportunities to learn, develop, and move up and across our global organization.
A diverse and inclusive community of belonging, where colleagues are empowered to bring ideas to the table, take risks, and act.
Generous Amgen Total Rewards Plan comprising healthcare, finance, wealth, and career benefits.
Flexible work arrangements.


APPLY NOW

Objects in your future are closer than they appear. Join us.

CAREERS.AMGEN.COM

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT

Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider you without regard to your race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.
