Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Our Team as a Data Analyst in Porto, Portugal! üåç

Who Are We?

Clever Advertising is a multinational digital brand serving the iGaming industry for the last 15 years with innovative advertising and technology solutions.

Why joining Clever?

Working with us means joining a diverse team where each member contributes to collective success, supporting one another through shared goals and passions. We not only focus on achieving excellent results but also enjoy the journey, making every day both fulfilling and fun.

Where‚Äôs the Action?

Our office in Porto ‚Äì a vibrant hub of innovation and culture, where great things happen every day!

What is my department like?

The Data Analytics team works closely with the Senior Management Team to accelerate data-driven decision-making. At the same time, we empower other teams by helping them work with key metrics and define meaningful visualisations. We are the heart of transforming raw data into actionable insights that fuel business growth!

What is my role like?

As a Data Analyst you will turn raw data into powerful insights! You‚Äôll help shaping data-driven strategies, create impactful visualisations, collaborate with teams to optimise business performance, and design scalable data structures‚Äîall while leveraging cutting-edge technologies like Python, SQL, AWS, and Power BI.

What will my daily tasks involve?

‚úì Process, model, and create data visualisations using programming languages and analytics technologies, including but not limited to Python, SQL, AWS (Redshift, S3, SageMaker, Glue), Power BI, etc.

‚úì Understand the business and how key numbers and KPIs connect day-to-day operations to the company‚Äôs future outcomes.

‚úì Collaborate with various teams (e.g. Commercial, Management) to identify information needs and support operational areas in optimising business performance through data models.

‚úì Define data structure requirements for analytics to help design data flows and processing pipelines.

What is expected from me?

‚úì Experience using tools for data cleaning and processing, such as Python, SQL, Git, AWS/GCP/Azure tools, Data Lakes, among others.

‚úì Proficiency in data modelling and visualisation using Power BI.

‚úì Ability to select and utilise appropriate visualisation models to enhance data interpretation from a business perspective.

‚úì Agility in understanding and assimilating business concepts, identifying key challenges, and translating them into technical solutions.

‚úì 3+ years of experience, with a passion for and capability in hands-on technical implementation of analyses and models.

What‚Äôs in It for You at Clever?

üí∞ Competitive Remuneration Package ‚Äì Because you deserve the best!

üíä Health Insurance ‚Äì Because your health matters!

üéâ Happiness Department & E.A.P. ‚Äì Holistic well-being and unlimited online psychology sessions with our in-house therapist.

üéÇ Birthday Leave ‚Äì Take the day off ‚Äî it‚Äôs all about you!

ü•ó Cafeteria with Healthy Options ‚Äì We're feeders, sorry!

üìö Continuous Learning Culture‚Äì Clever Academy and language classes.


and so much more!


At Clever, we believe in diversity and inclusion as drivers of innovation. We foster a work environment free from discrimination, where everyone has equal opportunities to succeed

Ready to make a Clever Choice? üöÄ

Title: Data Analyst (PowerBI)
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:

We are looking for a Data Analyst (PowerBI) to join one of our biggest clients in the Porto area (Hybrid). A multinational financial services firm, one of the largest financial groups and among the 30 largest financial institution‚Äôs globally.




What you will do:

Create and update PowerBI Dashboards
Collect data (internal & external) and investigate their business value through data analysis and visualization
Create and adapt data analysis models and tools
Mount, execute and automate ETL processes for extracting data (with python and SQL) to serve analytical needs
Develop & improve data quality controls and standardize processes and analyses
Use previous experience in marketing topics to translate business needs
Collect and visualize KPIs on the performance of our in-house models
Basic knowledge of data python packages




What you are like:

At least 4 years of experience as a Data Analyst;
Experience with PowerBI;
Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and frameworks, particularly Scrum;
Excellent communication skills - English;




Why join us

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
‚Ä¶ and much more!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: 3+ years

Location : Hybrid- Porto




Skills Needed?




Bachelor / Master in Computer Engineering or similar;
3+ years of experience in data analysis;
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and data extraction;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker);
Experience working with python;
Familiarity with databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Snowflake;
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills,
Good level of English and Portuguese;
Good level of french is a plus;
The candidate has to be in Portugal.







Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a data-driven professional to create dashboards and KPIs for a client in the automotive industry. If you have strong Power BI skills, a sharp analytical mindset, and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!




What will you do?

The data analyst consultant will be responsible for:

Collecting, cleaning, and analyzing data sets.
Conducting statistical analyses.
Collaborating with business teams to identify needs and propose suitable automation solutions.
Ensuring data visualization through BI tools such as Power BI.
Participating in the implementation of best data management practices within the department.




Who are you?

Proven experience as a data analyst in the banking sector, ideally in CIB.
Proficiency in BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and programming languages (e.g., Python).
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation, as well as other languages like DAX, M.
Knowledge of statistical models and predictive modeling techniques.
Excellent communication skills to interact with multidisciplinary teams: Business, IT, etc.
Experience in IT-driven project management.
Ability to formalize complex topics.
Goal-oriented mindset with a focus on deadlines;
Critical thinking and a proactive approach to identifying improvements.




Are you ready for this journey?! üé¢




Let's go!!! Apply today or send your CV directly to joel.leite@migso-pcubed.com!




You can check more detailed information in our website: https://www.migso-pcubed.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst for a hybrid project in Porto (twice a week in the office).




Requirements:

‚Ä¢ 6 to 9 years' experience

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Business Intelligence modeling (ODS, DWH, DTM)

‚Ä¢ Ability to write specifications and documentation

‚Ä¢ Expertise in Oracle and SQL language

‚Ä¢ Experience in data modeling and preparation using SSAS (Visual Studio Professional) and Power BI

‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of DAX

‚Ä¢ Fluent in English (both written and verbal) (mandatory)

‚Ä¢ The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory)




If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Business Intelligence (BI)
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Business Intelligence (BI)!




Mission: We are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with intermediate experience to work on data extraction, modeling, analysis and visualization using the Microsoft stack. The professional will be responsible for developing interactive dashboards, generating strategic insights and supporting decision-making through reliable and well-structured data.




Responsabilities:

Developing interactive reports and dashboards in Power BI.
Creating and optimizing queries in SQL Server for data extraction and processing.
Working with DAX for data modeling and metrics creation.
Performing ETL using Power Query.
Ensuring the quality and integrity of the data extracted and presented.
Collaborating with different areas of the business to understand needs and transform requirements into BI solutions.
Implementing good BI governance and security practices within the Microsoft environment.




Requirements:

Previous experience (2 to 5 years) with Power BI and its advanced features.
Solid knowledge of SQL for queries, manipulation and data modeling.
Experience in dimensional and relational data modeling.
Mastery of DAX for creating KPIs and custom metrics.
Knowledge of ETL tools, preferably Power Query.
Understanding of data governance and security concepts in BI.
Ability to work with large volumes of data and performance optimization.
Analytical skills and the ability to storytell with data.
Good communication skills and the ability to interact with stakeholders from different areas.
Good level of english.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/BI‚Äù




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

‚Ç¨40,000 - ‚Ç¨45,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

Porto (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate ‚Ç¨22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty‚Äôs, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Herm√®s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst - ESG Compliance
Description:
The Data Analyst - ESG Compliance will play a critical role in supporting the company‚Äôs Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives by supporting data collection, analysis, and reporting processes to help ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards.




Core Responsabilities:




Stay up to date on ESG reporting requirements and leading practices through training by reading ESG regulatory guidance, relevant thought leadership and/or ESG webcasts.
Working with ESG Compliance team and Global Finance Country Controllers, and Regional ESG Teams to support the collection, validation, and analysis of ESG data across various business unit to ensure accuracy, consistency and reliability of data and disclosures.
Drive continuous improvement efforts in the ESG reporting processes, systems and data management to streamline and optimize reporting efficiency and accuracy.
Support the develop training programs to educate employees on ESG policies, practices, and data management.
Manage time to meet established deadlines and milestones.
Responsive to business partner requests and foster positive working relationships with Local ESG Process Owners.
Plan and analyze assigned processes
Ensure adherence to all applicable department and professional standards.




Technical Competencies:




Relevant previous work experience in Accounting, Audit and/or the Finance field.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills.
Strong project management, analytical and problem solving skills.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is fully integrated in the global organization of Natixis, a French multinational financial services firm specialized in Asset & Wealth Management, Corporate & Investment Banking, Insurance and Payments. A subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, Natixis counts nearly 16.000 employees across 38 countries.

Based in Porto, Natixis Centre of Expertise mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the bank‚Äôs business, operations and work culture worldwide, as a key driver of the company‚Äôs culture of agility and innovation. Teams of IT and Banking Support Activities work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting all the business lines and country platforms.

Natixis in Portugal is the best combination of a ‚Äústart-up mindset‚Äù with a large, solid structure. Its unique culture gives true meaning to a ‚Äúbeyond banking‚Äù personality: to be a real entrepreneur, self-challenging, ever striving to excel and go that extra mile.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

As part of the Finance Direction, you will integrate the Financial Data Integrity department (FDI) which oversees the labelling of financial data for CIB activities of Natixis (balance sheet and off-balance sheet).

You will join a team of 6 people in Porto.

As a Senior Data Analyst, of a major French banking institution with international dimension, you will:


Support Data Management initiatives for Internal & Regulatory framework toward improvement of the quality of reports produced by Natixis CIB.
Participate in the Data monitoring for CIB activities (Financing, Global market, etc.)


You will be in contact with the other teams of FDI, internal Finance partners and Finance IT teams.

Main tasks and goals:

As a Senior Data Analyst, your primary tasks will be:

1- Data Systems and Analytics:


Develop solutions for data extraction, exploration, and transformation using SQL and other technologies.
Interface between business line and IT to translate business requirements into data sources and queries, supporting the creation of KPI metrics for dashboards.
Design and implement data architectures, along with new dashboards, to enhance business intelligence capabilities.
Manage and improve the use of data visualization tools like Power BI, ensuring the effective presentation of data to stakeholders;.
Own the creation and maintenance of scheduled reporting, including Power BI dashboards, to regularly inform business decisions.


2- Requirements and Coordination:


Oversee the full lifecycle of business requirements, from elicitation and analysis to documentation, management, and solution translation.
Plan and conduct workshops, interviews, and prototyping sessions to collect, clarify, and confirm business requirements.
Coordinate with Finance IT to monitor and prioritize the remediation plans and overall business requirements.
Ensure the effective coordination and implementation of financial issues remediation with relevant committees and IT teams.


3- Data Governance and Strategy (Technical View & Impact):


Participate in the coordination of the Data Domain Office (DDO) network for finance, including involvement in framework committees and data quality frameworks for projects regarding all technical requests.
Contribute to the strategic planning of Data Management roadmap, aiming to align data management practices with business objectives regarding the technical impact.


4- Monitoring and Collaboration:


Monitor the implementation of business requirements and data strategies in collaboration with IT teams.
Support the management and enhancement of data visualization and BI solutions, fostering a culture of data-driven decision making.
Collaborate with various teams to promote cross-functional unity and ensure the seamless integration of technical data insights into business processes.


Additional information:

You will be part of a bi-localized team with a local manager and a functional manager based in Paris, with regular interactions with the Paris team.

The ability to develop a network within the various teams of the Natixis ecosystem, and an aptitude for collaborative and group work are key factors of success in this position.

Qualifications

Qualifications:


Master‚Äôs degree in Finance, Math, Data Analytics, Data Science or Data Engineering;
Understanding of Data Governance and Data Management;
Knowledge in BCBS239 and the respective Streams;
Experienced with Finance / Banking Data (Banking environment, regulations, and products)
Advance expertise in Power BI and Tableau is essential, building automated reports and creating data-driven dashboards;
Knowledge of data transformation and analysis tools (Power Query, DAX, Excel, SQL and Python)
Synthesize complex datasets into clear, efficient, fast, useful, and appealing visualizations, dashboards and reports;
Knowledge in Big Data environments and technical tools for data analysis;
Experience with Atlassian Jira (as a plus);
Experience with Power BI Report Builder, Power Automate, and Power Apps (as a plus);
English (mandatory) and French (as a plus).


Soft Skills:


Strong communication and relationship-building skills;
Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities and attention to details;
Understand Business requirement and suggest right architecture;
Curious, proactive, and able to work in a fast-paced environment;
Teamwork orientation and coaching skills to foster a collaborative atmosphere.


Only CV¬¥s in English will be considered.

Additional Information

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. After grabbing a cup of coffee and fresh fruit, pick up your laptop and choose your spot for the day. It's going to be a busy one: French class before lunch and, just after, quick medical appointment at Natixis doctor's office. Lunch break. Outside in the big terrace (look at your crops at the Urban Garden; ready to harvest!) or, if you feel like stretching your legs, walk downtown to grab lunch.

Back inside. Quick sprint review (working together anywhere means virtual happy birthday to that colleague in Paris that just turned 35). The afternoon went flying (tasks, reports, calls, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: just one PlayStation game or the final match for that ping-pong tournament.

Tomorrow, you complete that certified technical training and the day after, you will work from home, taking advantage to finally do that online course on Udemy. Once you are done with your tasks for the day, you can visit the office for a board games session or show up at the rehearsal of one of Natixis bands. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to surf some waves or join them in a football match.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. Do you see yourself within these values?

Founded in 2006 under the mission "To Challenge Complexity", Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specialized in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.

By developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance or Aviation - we analyze data, transforming it into knowledge for our clients, allowing them to adopt the best decision-making for their respective organizations and businesses.

We seek a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.

*For this position you need to have residency in Porto.




ARE YOU THE ONE?




We are looking for a skilled data analyst to join our team to enhance our data management and business intelligence capabilities. The role will be responsible for the design and definition of data loading and transformation processes across three key layers: ODS, Data Warehouse and Data Mart. It will be required to carry out rigorous testing during the acceptance phase and to develop a comprehensive understanding of data supply chains to identify and resolve data quality issues. In addition, you will be required to model data in SSAS tabular cubes and Power BI semantic models, guaranteeing the integrity and security of our data flows from source to integration.

Technical Expertise:

Proficiency in Business Intelligence modeling (ODS, DWH, DTM).

Ability to write specifications and documentation.

Expertise in Oracle and SQL language.

Experience in data modeling and preparation using SSAS (Visual Studio Professional) and Power BI.

Advanced knowledge of DAX.

Other Skills:

Fluent in English (both written and verbal).




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send your CV to leonor.carvalho@closer.pt and reach the closest side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

Show more

We seek a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.

*For this position you need to have residency in Porto.


ARE YOU THE ONE?


We are looking for a skilled data analyst to join our team to enhance our data management and business intelligence capabilities. The role will be responsible for the design and definition of data loading and transformation processes across three key layers: ODS, Data Warehouse and Data Mart. It will be required to carry out rigorous testing during the acceptance phase and to develop a comprehensive understanding of data supply chains to identify and resolve data quality issues. In addition, you will be required to model data in SSAS tabular cubes and Power BI semantic models, guaranteeing the integrity and security of our data flows from source to integration.

Technical Expertise:

Proficiency in Business Intelligence modeling (ODS, DWH, DTM).

Ability to write specifications and documentation.

Expertise in Oracle and SQL language.

Experience in data modeling and preparation using SSAS (Visual Studio Professional) and Power BI.

Advanced knowledge of DAX.

Other Skills:

Fluent in English (both written and verbal).


If you believe in this match as much as we do, send your CV to leonor.carvalho@closer.pt and reach the closest side of life.


Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you driven by Technology?

If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge!

We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.

Red.it stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation.

Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions.

From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business.

With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.

Red.it is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion.

As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

We believe in creating an environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their unique perspectives and contributions.

Join the Wolfpack as a Data Analyst (Hybrid - Porto) !

What skills do you need to have?

Bachelor's degree in Engineering/Computing/Science or similar field.

4 years' experience in data preparation and reconciliation.

Proficiency in Alteryx, VBA and SQL.

Availability for occasional travel.

Fluency in English: French is highly valued.

Some of your responsibilities will be: Collaborate with business users to solve business problems.

Develop and maintain Alteryx workflows for data processing.

Ensure compliance with software governance rules.

Estimate and manage data project tasks.

A team focused on achieving objectives, motivation will not be lacking!

Red Team!

Red Training - We want to help you reach your potential.

Continuous career support and advice.

Red Follow Up Red Change - You love what you do, but want to explore other areas?

No problem Wolf!

There is time for everything, and fun is not left out.

Red Hours Red Spirit - If you want to go fast, go alone.

If you want to go far, GO TOGETHER!

Keywords: Data Analyst, Alteryx.

WHAT DRIVES YOU?

Apply here or through ****** and find out what moves us at www.redit.pt

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
ü§îWho are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 12 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




üöÄ Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

‚û° Quantitative Finance

‚û° Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

‚û° Operations and Finance

‚û° Transformation and Organization

‚û° Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of ‚Ç¨74.6 million.




üîéWe are looking for a Senior Data Analyst




MAIN TASKS:

Analyze and interpret complex data sets to inform business decisions
Develop data models and algorithms to solve business challenges
Provide actionable insights and recommendations to improve business strategies
Create and maintain dashboards and reports for data visualization
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decisions
Ensure data quality and consistency across all data sources







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Strong proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Experience with statistical analysis and data modeling techniques
Ability to interpret and present complex data to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Experience with big data technologies and databases (Hadoop, Spark, etc.) is a plus
Fluency in English (written and spoken)
French ‚Äì Practice




üìç Hybrid role based in Porto







üöÄIf you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
HTML:
Do you love transforming data into actionable insights?

At MIGSO-PCUBED, we are looking for a data-driven professional to develop dashboards, KPIs for a client in automotive sector. If you have strong Power BI skills, a keen analytical mindset, and the ability to collaborate across teams, we want to hear from you! üöÄ Are you our next Data Analyst?


Your key responsibilities:

  • Develop dashboards;
  • Monitor and optimize data processing;
  • Identify opportunities to improve indicators, reports, and processes;
  • Conduct data analysis.


What you bring:

  • Advanced knowledge of Power BI;
  • At least 3 years of experience in dashboard, KPI creation and monitoring;
  • Familiarity with Phyton and SQL;
  • Previous experience in banking sector;
  • Background in Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, or a related field is preferred;
  • Experience with statistical models;
  • Strong communication and negotiation skills with internal stakeholders;
  • Goal-oriented mindset with a focus on deadlines;
  • Critical thinking and a proactive approach to identifying improvements.


This is an hybrid position based in Porto.


Ready to take on this challenge? Apply now and join our team! üî•


You can check more detailed information in our website: https://www.migso-pcubed.com

Title: Junior Data & Analytics Consultant - French Speaker
Description:
Job Description

What to expect, your role


A Data & Analytics Consultant is responsible for supporting the capturing and detailing business processes and needs from our clients, through workshops, meetings, and documentation.
On a daily basis, you will be backing the team in developing data analytics solutions to support the effective operational, tactical and strategic decision making.
As part of this role consultants will be expected to:
Support the development of data solutions in Azure (using technologies such as Synapse Analytics, Fabric) to ingesting various sources into a unified data platform.
Design and deliver scalable PowerBI reports that provide actionable insights for a wide range of clients.


(throughout the L&D programme you will receive training to prepare you for these tasks)

Qualifications


Newly qualified graduates with less than three years‚Äô professional experience.
Degree in Data Science, Analytics, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics.
Fluency in English both written and oral.
Fluency in French both written and oral.
Credible client facing personality.
Strong presentation/communication/facilitation skills (oral and written).
Good problem solving and analytical skills.
Good knowledge of Microsoft Office productivity tools.
Knowledge of data systems and SQL (Preference).
Knowledge of BI tools e.g. Power BI, Tableau (Desirable).
Knowledge of programming languages e.g. Python, DAX/M, SQL, C#, R (Desirable).
Good organisational skills.
A strong sense of responsibility and autonomy.
Ability to work independently and well within a team.
Availability to travel abroad.
A demonstrable passion for technology.


Additional Information

What To Expect, Your Benefits


Career development: we assign you a personal Career Development Mentor (CDM) to support. and guide you during your journey with us.
Flexible and friendly work environment (hybrid work model, work-life balance).
Competitive salary.
Health insurance.
25 annual leave days.
Mobile phone and public transport allowances.
Employee Assistance Programme.
Be part of one of the best IT consultancy companies in the world.


Beware of scams

Our recruiting team may communicate with candidates via our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address and/or via our SmartRecruiters (Applicant Tracking System) [email protected] domain email address regarding your application and interview requests.

All offers will originate from our @hitachisolutions.com domain email address. If you receive an offer or information from someone purporting to be an employee of Hitachi Solutions from any other domain, it may not be legitimate.

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Officer
Description:
About The Job

Global Markets is BNP Paribas‚Äô capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutionals, corporates, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning‚Ä¶). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long term opportunities.

Your Main Activities Are

The purpose of the role is to Drive the Business Intelligence for FX+, including (but not limited to) reporting on the activity, tracking of the business case, management of the Revenue Sharing Agreements, pricing and booking models enhancements, business development and tracking of the operational quality.


Monitor the FX Payments activity and the revenue sharing
Monitor activity KPIs (volumes, revenues, pricing ‚Ä¶) for all geographies / clients
Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up‚Ä¶)
Build a state of the art industrial ‚ÄúClient Intelligence‚Äù solutio
Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs ‚Ä¶)


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas (preferential)
Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
Fluency in English (mandatory)
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills ‚Äì (Intermediate)
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs ‚Ä¶)


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
What we are looking for

Wiimers are bright, curious, enthusiasts, hard-working individuals together on a mission: delivering expert-trained decision-aid models and digital solutions to data-intensive industries, by combining business acumen, advanced analytics and information technologies.¬†

This time we are looking for a Analytics Consultant eager to work in projects with a strong focus on ¬†the Energy and Utilities Sector.




At Wiimer you will

Participate in AI & data analytics end-to-end client projects, tackling complex business problems with strategic thinking and creativity, and developing solutions that bring significant business value to our clients;¬†

Be involved in highly dynamic teams, multi-disciplinary and cross-industry projects (although a strong focus in the Energy and Utilities sector is expected)¬†

Be in direct contact with the client and be involved in meetings to present results and insights to the client;¬†

Be responsible for core project activities, including, notably, extraction, transformation and loading of datasets, as well as developing learning algorithms and BI dashboards.¬†




What you'll need to succeed

Degree/master‚Äôs in engineering, computer science, information technologies or related field;¬†
Working and/or academic background in the Energy and Utilities Sector (not mandatory, although appreciated);¬†
3 to 5 years of relevant technical experience in analytics /business intelligence delivering end-to-end projects;¬†
Understanding of machine learning and optimization techniques and algorithms;¬†
Experience in data engineering and ML programming languages (Python and/or R);¬†
Experience in working MLOps tools (e.g. MLflow) (not mandatory, although appreciated);¬†
Experience with Big Data frameworks ( e.g. Azure ML, Databricks, GCP) ¬†and visualization tools (i.e. PowerBI);
Experience in SQL programming with data bases, such as SQL Server, MySQL, SQLite, PostgreSQL;¬†
Experience with generative AI tools (e.g. Azure OpenAI and ChatGPT builder) (not mandatory, although appreciated);¬†
Excellent English language skills;¬†
Knowledge in Agile methodology, using tools like Planner, Trello or Jira;¬†
Written and verbal communication skills.¬†




At Wiimer you will find

At Wiimer, we offer more than just a workplace. You‚Äôll discover a dynamic and collaborative environment, where every day brings new and exciting challenges, working with major clients across various geographies. We prioritize work-life balance, offering a hybrid work model and flexible benefits designed around your needs. And when your birthday comes, it‚Äôs time to celebrate ‚Äì with the day off.

We are committed to your ongoing development, providing access to specialized learning platforms and continuous training opportunities. At Wiimer, we foster an environment where your professional journey and personal development thrive together, all within a supportive, human-centered, and inclusive culture.¬†

Wiimer is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We foster a diverse culture where individual differences are recognized and appreciated.

What we are looking for

Wiimers are bright, curious, enthusiasts, hard-working individuals together on a mission: delivering expert-trained decision-aid models and digital solutions to data-intensive industries, by combining business acumen, advanced analytics and information technologies. 

This time we are looking for a Analytics Consultant eager to work in projects with a strong focus on  the Energy and Utilities Sector.


At Wiimer you will

Participate in AI & data analytics end-to-end client projects, tackling complex business problems with strategic thinking and creativity, and developing solutions that bring significant business value to our clients; 

Be involved in highly dynamic teams, multi-disciplinary and cross-industry projects (although a strong focus in the Energy and Utilities sector is expected) 

Be in direct contact with the client and be involved in meetings to present results and insights to the client; 

Be responsible for core project activities, including, notably, extraction, transformation and loading of datasets, as well as developing learning algorithms and BI dashboards. 


What you'll need to succeed

  • Degree/master‚Äôs in engineering, computer science, information technologies or related field; 
  • Working and/or academic background in the Energy and Utilities Sector (not mandatory, although appreciated); 
  • 3 to 5 years of relevant technical experience in analytics /business intelligence delivering end-to-end projects; 
  • Understanding of machine learning and optimization techniques and algorithms; 
  • Experience in data engineering and ML programming languages (Python and/or R); 
  • Experience in working MLOps tools (e.g. MLflow) (not mandatory, although appreciated); 
  • Experience with Big Data frameworks ( e.g. Azure ML, Databricks, GCP)  and visualization tools (i.e. PowerBI);
  • Experience in SQL programming with data bases, such as SQL Server, MySQL, SQLite, PostgreSQL; 
  • Experience with generative AI tools (e.g. Azure OpenAI and ChatGPT builder) (not mandatory, although appreciated); 
  • Excellent English language skills; 
  • Knowledge in Agile methodology, using tools like Planner, Trello or Jira; 
  • Written and verbal communication skills. 


At Wiimer you will find

At Wiimer, we offer more than just a workplace. We are committed to your ongoing development, providing access to specialized learning platforms and continuous training opportunities. At Wiimer, we foster an environment where your professional journey and personal development thrive together, all within a supportive, human-centered, and inclusive culture. 

Wiimer is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We foster a diverse culture where individual differences are recognized and appreciated.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn an incentive of ‚Ç¨50 for passing the entrance exam by the 9th of October*
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Portugese.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







T&C's apply*




Apply Online Today!

Title: Time Series Researcher | IS Team (Job Ref.: AICOS_Jobs_2025_01) | Porto, Portugal
Description:
Job Title: Time Series Researcher

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_01

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description And Responsibilities

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOS is looking for an entry-level researcher to join the Intelligent Systems group and specialize in time series analysis, machine learning (ML), and causal AI applied to health data.

As a researcher at AICOS you will work at the forefront of AI innovation, creating purposeful technologies that positively transform industries, promoting social well-being and improving quality of life.

Your Role


Develop and implement advanced time series models to analyse temporal health data, including physiological signals, wearable sensor data, and electronic health records.
Research and develop cutting edge ML techniques to integrate tabular and time series data for health-related applications.
Investigate and apply the latest breakthroughs in causal AI to enhance understanding, prediction, and decision-making in health-related challenges.
Deliver clear and concise reports on developed models and provide proper software documentation.


Your Profile


Academic Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent academic qualifications in the area of Biomedical Engineering.
Excellent Python programming skills and experience with data science and ML frameworks (e.g., Pandas, Scikit-learn, SciPy, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, etc.).
Solid background in ML, deep learning and time series analysis.
Hands-on experience in integrating time series with tabular data to address health-related challenges.
Familiarity with causal AI techniques and their application.
Excellent communication skills in English (technical and business audiences).


We Value


In-depth knowledge of machine learning pipelines (data collection, data labelling, data preparation, model development, model evaluation, model optimization, model deployment and model monitoring).
Experience with time series and causal AI techniques applied to health data, and a willingness to deepen expertise is this emerging field.
Ability to work with cross-functional teams.
Autonomous, dependable, and enthusiast team-player.
Problem-solving, proactive, and critical-thinking attitude.


Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal


People-centric work environment that encourages creativity and the development of new ideas, in which personal and career development go hand in hand.
Opportunity to contribute to stimulating national and international projects spanning through different innovation topics and application areas.
Boost your technical growth.
Make a difference in creating AI solutions that generate value and impact.
Flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home.
Excellent conditions of employment including attractive salary (depending on the academic degree and professional experience), private health insurance plan, access to entrepreneurship programmes.


Application Process

Applications are permanently open until the ideal candidate is selected.

The selected candidate is expected to start working in February 2025.

Applications must be made to the email jobs@fraunhofer.pt and contain:


CV ‚Äì mandatory;
Motivation Letter;
Recommendation Letters are optional but also welcome.


Observation

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of projects:


CardioCausalAI - Exploring Causal AI to Improve Risk Management and Service Delivery in Cardiothoracic Surgery, under Notice No. 04/C05-i08/2024 (Artificial Intelligence, Data Science and Cybersecurity of relevance to Public Administration).
SmILE - Smart Implants for Life Enrichment, under Notice No. HORIZON-HLTH-2023-STAYHLTH-01-01.

Title: Personal Data Protection Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for Personal Data Protection Analyst!




Responsibilities:

Ensure group project validation processes comply with Privacy by Design principles, and supporting Project Managers on their data protection activities".
Manage incoming external and internal requests in the outlook inbox CIB GDPR DESK, including Data Subject RightsRequests.
Publish the group GDPR DESK periodic report and manage a dedicated SharePoint space.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of personal data protection within group develop and share best practices with the data protection network.




Requirements:

Full proficiency of MSOffice suite Proficiency of project management tools and methodologies.
Language Skills Fluent English (C1-C2).
Excellent writing, communication and interpersonal skills Attention to detail and high sense of rigor and organization.
Ability to synthesize and simplify complex concepts to a senior audience.
Proactiveness and ability to leverage on transversal networks.
Ability to work in a changing environment / Adaptability.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúCA/PersonalDataProtectionAnalyst‚Äù




Thank You! üòä




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Engineer w/ French
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • At least 4 years of experience in similar roles;
  • Proficiency in Oracle SQL;
  • Experience in KSH (KornShell) scripting;
  • Hands-on experience with Python development (focused on data handling);
  • Good understanding of CI/CD principles, tools, and automated testing;
  • Cloud experience with containers and Object Storage (COS), including S3-type protocols;
  • Experience working with Docker;
  • Good knowledge of French (minimum B2 level).


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee ‚Äì the system that includes Aubay‚Äôs Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: hybrid;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • We don‚Äôt have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • You will grow in good company.Isn‚Äôt this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for!


We will use personal information that you have sent us to consider your application for the relevant function. By giving us your information/documents by email, you consent to Aubay Portugal treating your personal information. Your privacy is important to us. Please check our Privacy Policy, which explains how we will use and store your personal information. It also explains the rights you have regarding your information and how you can contact us for clarification of questions or requests.

Title: CRM Data Analyst
Description:
ABOUT US üöÄ

Hostelworld Group, the global hostel-focussed online booking platform, inspires adventurous minds to meet the world and come back with life-changing stories to tell. Our customers are not your average tourists, they crave cultural connection and unique experiences that we make possible by providing an unbeatable selection of hostels in unmissable locations ‚Äì all in the palm of their hand.

It is the social nature and community feel of hostels and their environment, that enable travellers to embrace journeys of discovery, adventure and meaning. We have more than 13 million reviews across 17,800 hostels in more than 179 countries, making the brand the leading online hub for social travel. The website operates in 19 different languages and our mobile app in 13 languages.

Founded in 1999 and headquartered in Dublin, Hostelworld has a growing, high-calibre team of 230 people within Technology, Product, Global Markets, HR, Finance & Legal and Marketing Teams across our Dublin, London, Porto, Shanghai and Sydney offices. Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange and Dublin Euronext. You can read more about our story here.




LOCATIONüåç

This role is based in Portugal. We have an office hub in Porto available for those who prefer a hybrid model where you can spend time with colleagues in-person. You will need to be able to commute to our office hub as required from time to time.




WHO YOU'LL WORK WITH üë®üèΩ‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèº

We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights (A&I) ‚Äì all working towards one common goal with aligned objectives.

This role sits in the Mobile Analytics Team reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics. We are seeking a CRM Analyst to play a crucial role in enhancing our customer relationships through data-driven insights. You will be instrumental in analysing customer behaviours, segmenting audiences, and optimising our marketing efforts to improve customer engagement and retention. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about leveraging data to drive business decisions and enhance the customer journey in the travel sector. You will be working with best in class technology and working within a wider motivated team of data analysts, engineers and scientists.

Our core data stack:

Front End Tracking: Google Analytics
CDP: Segment
CRM: Iterable
Data Storage: GCP & Snowflake
Data Visualisation and Usage: Tableau, Snowflake, Vertex AI
Orchestration: Airflow
Transformation: DBT
Synching data: Fivetran, Hightouch, Twilio Segment




WHAT YOU'LL DO üë©‚Äçüíª

Develop and maintain segments for personalised marketing campaigns based on customer behaviour, demographic data, and booking patterns.
Analyse CRM data to provide actionable insights on customer lifecycle, loyalty, and retention.
Collaborate with the mobile team to design, test, and optimize campaigns across multiple channels.
Monitor and report on the performance of CRM initiatives, providing regular updates to senior management on their impact on revenue and customer engagement.
Manage the integration of new data sources into the CRM system to ensure a holistic view of the customer.
Utilise advanced analytical techniques to predict customer behaviours and identify opportunities for growth and improvement.




WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR üëÄ

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in CRM analytics or a related field, preferably in the travel or tech industry.
Strong analytical skills with experience in SQL, Excel, and CRM software (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot).
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Knowledge of statistical modeling and data mining techniques is a plus.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of agile project management and familiarity with working alongside engineering teams to prioritize product enhancements.




WHAT WE OFFER üíØ

Competitive salary & benefits
Enhanced annual leave plus 3 Wellbeing Days per year
Paid family leave (maternity, paternity, surrogacy & adoption)
Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
Support for your ongoing growth & development
Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)
A chance to give back to your local community with 5 paid volunteering days




We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. If you don‚Äôt meet them all, please consider applying if you think you can still perform the role as described.

  • Agile working (plus a Working from Abroad Policy!)
  • Support for your ongoing growth & development
  • Inclusive people policies (sickness, menopause, compassionate and fertility leave)

We believe in talented and diverse teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and the communities in which we operate. Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences. We lay out the above requirements to guide applicants to the experiences that we believe will allow you to be successful in the role. Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!

We are looking for an Amazing: Data Engineer

Seniority: Mid (3-5 years)

Type of position: Remote from Portugal. The candidates must be in Portugal.

The amazing you, will have:


Building processes for extraction, transformation and loading throughout the data lifecycle
Building dashboards using set analysis to give them more flexibility
Monitoring and resolving tickets on the technologies in question
Good communication and interpersonal interaction
Good relationship with different client stakeholders, with the aim of gathering business requirements and monitoring UAT tests
Good command of English Translated with DeepL.com (free version)
QlikSense
Qlik NPrinting




Why should you become part of our family?


You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!


Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote



Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Information Technology Business Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for an IT Business Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

‚Ä¢ 4 years minimum of experience working as an IT Business Analyst and having worked on IT projects in Financial Institutions;

‚Ä¢ Experience in gathering requirements and creating functional specifications;

‚Ä¢ Experience in testing developed functionalities;

‚Ä¢ Experience in SQL;

‚Ä¢ Experience in Jira and Confluence;

‚Ä¢ Previous experience working with Scrum methodologies;

‚Ä¢ Fluency in English (mandatory);

‚Ä¢ The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).

If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV in English.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you driven by Technology?

If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge!

We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.

Red.it stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation.

Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions.

From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business.

With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.

Red.it is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion.

As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.

We believe in creating an environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their unique perspectives and contributions.

Join the Wolfpack as a Data Analyst (Hybrid - Porto) !

What skills do you need to have?

Bachelor's degree in Engineering/Computing/Science or similar field.

4 years' experience in data preparation and reconciliation.

Proficiency in Alteryx, VBA and SQL.

Availability for occasional travel.

Fluency in English: French is highly valued.

Some of your responsibilities will be: Collaborate with business users to solve business problems.

Develop and maintain Alteryx workflows for data processing.

Ensure compliance with software governance rules.

Estimate and manage data project tasks.

A team focused on achieving objectives, motivation will not be lacking!

Red Team!

Red Training - We want to help you reach your potential.

Continuous career support and advice.

Red Follow Up Red Change - You love what you do, but want to explore other areas?

No problem Wolf!

There is time for everything, and fun is not left out.

Red Hours Red Spirit - If you want to go fast, go alone.

If you want to go far, GO TOGETHER!

Keywords: Data Analyst, Alteryx.

WHAT DRIVES YOU?

Apply here or through ****** and find out what moves us at www.redit.pt
